Reviews.Title: “LOVELY VENICE”
Reviews.Author: PADDYMSCOTLAND
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Venice. This was our first trip and we weren't disappointed. We were only here for 2 days but may be 3 might have been a bit better. It was the beginning of April and the weather was warm. We stayed at the Duodo Palace Hotel, which we was a lovely hotel. We the breakfast was lovely and the rooms were very suptuous, The staff were always curteous and polite. Our only small quibble would be there was not complimentary tray in the room for tea/coffee etc. We had our own kettle and stuff as we took a flask of coffee with us on our walks to save having to always find a cafe we would stop at any of the endless amazing views. The hotel was very central too. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooking a Venitian Canal”
Reviews.Author: traveler10131
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Venice and we arrived at the hotel door by water taxi. Great staff. We spoke no Italian but it was no problem. Wonderful room overlooking a canal. Nice breakfast. Very clean. I have arthritis and the elevator was necessary and great. Some say it was hard to find but using the water taxi solves that problem. Close to the Venetian Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daveb36
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 night stay at duodo for a joint silver wedding celebration staff were very nice rooms very clean and comfortable and decorated in true venetion style. Would recommend the water taxi transfer to arrive in style and think it would be hard to find otherwise. great location for all sights but its very easy to get lost in venice so buy a good map would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leinsterman
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 4 nights at the Duodo Palace Hotel. It's a very central hotel, with a canal running alongside - the water taxi drew up to the door. A very enjoyable stay, the staff were all friendly, helpful and efficient. I have some Italian, enough to cover the basics, but anyway the staff all spoke fluent English. Breakfast was included in the room price and was a buffet of fruit, cold meat, cheese, rolls, croissants, yoghourt, tea or coffee and champagne for those who wanted it!. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, as was the en-suite bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. Despite being so central, the surroundings were very quiet. Staff were helpful with local knowledge. Very good value and a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location , helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Borgcruiser
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night weekend in Venice booked through British Airways. Duodo Palace Hotel is located in an excellent location easy access from the Alilunga stops at Rialto and San Marco. I was allocated room #204 , no issues with the cleanliness, bathroom was spotless and very modern.Bed linen was changed daily . Only downside to this room is it feels like a corridor , 2 single beds in line with a chair between. Small wardrobe and in room safe. Doubt this room would be suitable for two people, rather cramped. Excellent Continental breakfast. Extremly pleasant hotel and bar staff. Michael the bar man was very attentive, Thanks for that Michael.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: EriClaud54
Reviews.Content: I felt the staff at the hotel to be helpful, but a little on the snooty side. I just couldn't help but think they were looking down their noses at us. Besides that, the room was spacious and very clean. The location was excellent with only a short walk to most of the main sites. The hotel was very quiet at night, so we had no trouble sleeping after our long days.

Reviews.Title: “Duodo Palace Hotel - excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ruth A
Reviews.Content: We, my son and I, stayed at the Duodo Palace Hotel on March 10-14 2012. We stayed at many hotels in Europe, but never got so kindly and hearty treatment from the crew who was always ready to help us with EVERY topic. We're still astonish of the amazing experience of the staying at this amazing hotel. And besides, the location is excellent - 1 minute to the opera house (La Fenice), and a few minutes to San Marco piaza - the central square in Venice. Sorry if I forgot something... Our grade is 100% !!!!!!!!! Ciao Duodo Palace Hotel See you again :-) Ruthie and Tal Aviv, Israel

Reviews.Title: “a hiddon gem”
Reviews.Author: karl-sugden
Reviews.Content: iv just come back from a 3 day trip in venice and stayed at the wonderfull duodo palace hotel i was greeted with a smile witch is always nice and there made me feel very welcome i was in room 604 ok it did not have a view but the room was very nice and just prefect for me the bathroom was all so very lovely done out and had a lovely shower witch i like the hotel is in a great location and close to all main attractions shops and restaurants i can recommend a couple of lovely restaurants for dining out as i am very fussy and like upmarket placers one is called osteria san marco but you must book as its very busy and the food is wonderfull trust me food is my passion the 2nd is called a beccafico the hotel will tell you were it is but try and go its excellent food and once again you need to book back to the reviews on the hotel all the staff were very helpfull and breakfast in the hotel was nice i would recommend this hotel and i will be definatly staying hear again in the near future i want to thank all the staff for a lovely stay at the duodo palace thanks once again and keep up the good work karl

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrocksWestSussex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally placed - easy walk to San Marco and St Angelo water bus stops. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. Breakfast is a good choice and comments about it not being so, are picky! Our room (#206) had a canal view and was clean and comfortably. Only had a small issue on one morning - the bathroom for room 205 protrudes into the corner of the room and on our first morning we were woken by a lady with a voice to kill at 100 paces, singing loudly in the bath! Thankfully they obviously left on our first day and were replaced by nice quiet people! The drinks in the bar are very generous measures - trebles at least! All in all - would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YNWYM
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room which was a decent size with ensuite bathroom. Both were clean, tidy and in good repair. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent. Very close to La Fenice Opera House and half way between St. Mark's Square and The Rialto Bridge and an easy walk to both.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WizardsRUs2
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. The rooms were most spacious and our room had an elaboratly painted ceiling. You didnt get a very friendly atmosphere in the breakfast room. The waiter almost made us feel uncomfortable as he didnt even say grazi or prago like everyone else in Italy. There wasnt much of a selection of food either, simply cornflakes, bowls of fruit and toast or croisants. The coffee took the fur off the back of your tongue too. But for a convenient place to stay, a short walk past the antique shops to either St Marks Square or the Rialto Bridge made it the place to stay as it was away from the hustle and bustle of the centre of Venice therefore in the height of summer you would be assured of a peaceful stay which you wouldnt get in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are spot on but.....”
Reviews.Author: Jan6794
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you would expect from these reviews. A litle gem. However dont fall for the free trip to Murano. I wish I had read those reviews before our visit. Yes, you feel really special being whisked off from the hotel in your own water taxi, a private guide to a 5 minute glass blow in the factory then the hard sell begins. You are then left outside to catch the waterbus home. The hotel must be party to this rip off.... beware, leaves a bad taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “xmas holiday 2011”
Reviews.Author: davidm M
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel late January 2012, and while the outside looked very average, the entrance foyer and bar/type areas very well presented and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful, and readily provided advise on directions and tours and made bookings for us. We paid extra for a canal room, and the room was exceptional in size, comfort and cleaniness. Our room included breakfast, everything except aussie eggs, but plently of meats, cheeses, buns, toast, cereals. and even champaign. Very handly to all the main tourist spots, plenty of places to eat, one minute walk to the teatro de finice etc.. Would recommend staying here, and will definately stay here again when next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ang196
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel, from the beautiful entrance, the frescoed room, the staff etc etc We were treated like very special guests when we arrived by the wonderful Francesco, in fact all the staff were friendly, helpful and very pleasant all the time. The included breakfast was very good, cereals, meats, cheeses and wonderful hot tea and coffee. My other half had the bacon and eggs one morning, extra charge for it, and he said it was excellent, I believe it was about 7 euros. The hotel arranged a free trip to Murano, where we were under no pressure to buy, and we even asked then to arrange our Gondola trip for us, as we trusted them to make a good decision on our behalf. We were upgraded to a superior room, #206, which was beautiful. It had fabric covered walls and a frescoed ceiling, and a view of the small canal outside. We even had tea making facilities ready and waiting for us in the room, which was just what we needed. We just used to ask for refills of supplies, and fresh milk when we passed reception, and were always given a decent supply with a smile. We had cocktails in the bar every night, 5 euros each, strong and worth the price. We even had a pizza one evening in the bar and it was as good as ones we had in decent restaurants in Venice, I believe they were 10 euros each. Overall the Duodo Palace is a beautiful, traditional hotel with helpful, cheerful staff who will help you in any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scratch81
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The 4 stars are well deserved, with nice rooms, very polite always smiling staff, and very reasonable drinks prices at the bar (in comparison to the rest of venice). The location is spot on for central venice, close to the main Square. The teatro de fenice is literally on the doorstep, and the hotel has a waterfront entrance for that grand welcome to venice We were in venice for wifes birthday, and we were pleasantly surprised with a round of dirnks on the house to celebrate. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone for a stay in venice. Thanks Duodo Palace

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Victoria C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 2012. Very friendly & helpful staff. Good breakfast. Standard room adequate, I say this because nothing like the pictures. We did look at a canal side room but really didn't feel we got anything extra ( for extra 70e) as had to stand on tiptoes to look out the window down into canal, which when the tide was out was a bit smelly. We had a standard room, small but well designed layout except for it was very dark. The heating was controlled by the front desk & they seemed to have difficulty in setting it to our requested temperature. It was -5c outside so difficult to leave the windows open. Hair dryer useless and lighting not designed for reading, could do with some good bedside lights. No tea making facilities in the room but will provide tea tray free of charge(2.50E for delivery to your room, unless you take it up yourself).

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location”
Reviews.Author: weberkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early jan after a ski trip in the Dolomites and had a fantastic time. Staff were very helpful with recommendations and rooms were nice and clean. Only qualm was that we paid for a deluxe room and the other half of our party paid standard and their room was probably better than ours. Overall very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellcent service, always there to help and so friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Dgreen830
Reviews.Content: What a start to the year, went for 3 days in january 2012. The greatest hotel I have stayed in. Clean, staff always there to help you. It was our 2nd anniversary and they upgraded our room and had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. Breakfast was fantastic, anything we asked for they were always there to help. They arranged a free trip To murano for us and it's a place worth visiting, seeing all the glass chandeliers was fantastic. We would recommend the Duodo hotel to everyone, the staff are fantastic. Thank you to all staff at the Duodo palace for making our first time in Venice so special, we will definitely be returning soon . Dave and Angela from Manchester.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent return trip to Duodo Palace”
Reviews.Author: Joanne E
Reviews.Content: Re-booked this place for 4 nights for a romantic winter break after a great stay here a couple of years ago. Paid only around Â£70 per night for a double last time, around Â£80 this time (search your websites). This time we were up on the 4th floor in a slightly smaller but really characterful room with beams on the sloping ceiling and views over the rooftops, looking out towards the tower of the Frari. Loved it. Arrived on the evening of Thursday 5th Jan and said we'd stayed once already. Five mins later we were brought up a bottle of Prosecco in an ice bucket as a welcome back gift. Duodo's rooms are lovely - really nice, plush, Venetian decor (love the padded walls!), with a fridge and TV. Cosy beds. Staff are really pleasant, buffet breakfast is good, everybody staying here seems very happy. Rooms are cleaned every day but always while you're out - no noise from the (also lovely) cleaners. The following day (with the Befana Regatta and all the festivites) was one of the best days I've ever had. Whether it's this good in the summer months I couldn't say. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “best”
Reviews.Author: crystal t
Reviews.Content: I agree that the hotel was a bit difficult to find. This was our 2nd time staying there. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. the bartender/waiter even let us borrow his bottle opener. The rooms are very nice and most importantly clean. This hotel is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Stuart L
Reviews.Content: The Duodo Palace is tricky to find - especially after a good glug of wine around the maze which is town. We got lost every niight upon our return. That aside, the hotel is beautiful, classy, comfortable and the service is old fashioned and courteous. The decor is dated but in this old converted palace it remains elegant. A complimentary bottle of good Prosecco in an ice bucket was delivered to our room on the first night which was a lovely touch. Breakfast is fresh with lots of choice and typical Italian quality. I cannot think of anything negative to see about the Duodo Palace and we had a great deal and a great time. If I knew I could stay in a place like this in any city then I would happily do so. 10/10

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine A
Reviews.Content: I am long overdue in writing this review but felt I should as we had such a wonderful time staying here. We stayed 4 nights, and found the hotel to be of beautiful Venetian style, with excellent staff. Rooms are a fair size with large bathroom (or at least ours was). The location is perfect for exploring, with the main sites just minutes away. A memory of this hotel I will never forget is our gondola ride - ask at reception and concierge can arrange one to pick you up from the hotel, and for a reasonable price! Lovely atmosphere in this hotel I would definitely stay here again without hesitation and recommend ot to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pre xmas break”
Reviews.Author: cantwards
Reviews.Content: We booked the duodo palace having read the reviews on trip advisor. They were really accurate and helpful. Although a little difficult to find initially once there found it is in an amazing central location. Upon arrival the staff were very welcoming and escorted us to our room. The reception staff were able to reccommend restaurants etc - nothing was too much trouble. The room was good - very venetian in style and very comfortable. The breakfast included was good, the bar staff in the evening were very courteous and helpful. The cocktails amazing value at only five euros. All in all we had a superb three night break in Venice and this was due in no small part to the fantastic hotel with its great location. We highly reccommend this hotel and would happily return

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Janey87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated quite highly on tripadvisor and it definetly didnt disappoint, the room was a decent size, the staff were friendly, they had porters to take the bags to the room and help you off the boats at the water entrance. The breakfast was continental but you had the option each morning to order a hot breakfast, there was plenty of juices and options, we came down at 10.25 (breakfast finishes at 10.30) and they still fit us in and did not rush us, we would defintely stay in the this hotel again, highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic place with friendly service right in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: julia1976
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we had a hard time finding the hotel - but when we arrived, we were greeted with perfect hospitality and in fluent German (it's not something we expect, but lots of people will appreciate). The desk service was very friendly and gave decent advice on restaurants in the area. We liked our room a lot - a friendly big room with very high walls, no view, but the feeling of being in a palazzo veneziano did make up for it. The bathroom wasn't huge, but big enoug for a bath tube which we didn't use this time, but noticed positively for further visits. Breakfast service was very friendly and very good - we even enjoyed prosecco for my bf's birthday. The waiters/waitresses were friendly and professional, the service quick - no complaints. We've spent many journeys in Venice on a budget and this was defininitely the best and most luxurious (first week of December 2011)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: Italomaniac
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff did everything they could to make our stay as delightful as possible. We nipped out for dinner on our first night to find a bottle of chilled Prosecco waiting for us, in the room, on our return. our room was spacious, warm, and we even had a painted fresco on the ceiling. When the staff realized we were British, without so much as a murmur from us, a kettle appeared in the room, together with tea bags, etc. etc. The location is wonderful, very central. However, if you're not familiar with Venice, you might like to ask hotel staff for the short cuts to Accademia, and Rialto. You are no more than 7 minutes from both. And about 5 to St Mark's square. So, it is a perfect position for getting around Venice, and a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base”
Reviews.Author: Christopher F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights here. Although it is only about 10 mins easy walk (with wheelie suit cases) from the S Marco water bus stop the hotel would be difficult to find without detailed directions. I sent the manager a photocopy of a street map and asked him to mark the hotel and route from the water bus landing. He did and sent it back to me; so no problem. The hotel's situation is quite central with the San Marco Piazza, the Rialto and the Accademia all within very easy reach (we are in our 70s). Our bedroom was delightful - spacious and well equipped with an excellent bathroom. The dining room for the generous buffet breakfast was a nice place to be with very friendly and polite staff. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. There are small restaurants and trattorias close by suppers. We have no adverse criticisms and will certainly return. We booked through Trailfinders who obtained a very reasonably priced package with British Airways flights. By the way, at Marco Polo Airport it is only a 10 min under-cover walk from Arrivals to the water bus and then about 50 mins to S Marco; a very enjoyable and stress-free way to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria R
Reviews.Content: Very elegant Hotel, only about 6-7 minute walk to main shopping areas and St Marks Square. The breakfast was very nice. This Hotel is located right next to a canal. This was our last stop before returning home and it was a nice hotel to finish off our trip. The staff were very helpful. Ladies take your own hairdryer - the hotel one not the best. Would highly recommend this hotel for value for money, it was heaps cheaper and better than the one we stayed in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NAHR1234
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a superbly central, yet quiet location. Very attentive staff, but please turn the heating down!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chOntario
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise departure based on the reviews on this website and we weren't disappointed! Pulling up to the door in a water taxi and being escorted up the steps to the check in desk was an amazing experience. The staff were extremely polite and our room on the second floor was quite nice. Beautiful, and spotless large windows with a king size bed and a beautiful bathroom. The ceiling in the room was a work of art! Our favourite part was the breakfast which was included in the room price. Fresh fruit cup, warm croissants that melt in your mouth, and the best coffee we have ever had in our life. All this and free internet service. We found all the staff extremely helpful and one of their better recommendations was the restaurant "Rossa's" (a favourite of Johnny Depp's while filming a recent movie) which is a three minute walk from the hotel. Everything is extremely close with a walk to St. Mark's Square being only about seven or eight minutes. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noodles1691
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and could not have asked for anything more - beautiful hotel, polite and helpful staff, delicious breakfast, cheap cocktails, hot water - was absolutely perfect for our getaway. I think we were lucky in getting one of the slightly larger rooms as we felt it was more than comfortable. Yes the prices for the breakfast extras was a little over the top - but you don't HAVE to have eggs! The rest of the breakfast was delicious and the bar serving delicious ham and cheese toasties for only â‚¬4 was very handy! Overall, a fantastic stay - would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “EXELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Ellieee22
Reviews.Content: I had a very lovely stay in this hotel. Room wasn't very big but every other thing was perfect: good services and facilities in the hotel, a very good breakfast with quality and typical products, very professional staff, stilish and elegant forniture,large bathroom. enter in this hotel is like living a dream :) the only disavantage I noticed is that the double bed is made adding 2 single bed and this can be less confortable than having a real double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but praise”
Reviews.Author: Discriminat0r
Reviews.Content: We had a large, lovely room on the first floor overlooking the canal. Maybe in summer it might be a little sniffy but in October with the occasional gondola (and musical accompaniment) going by it was magical. Staff were efficient and always pleasant. Great central position. Good breakfasts. Venice food expensive and ghastly but the Restaurant al Theatre around the corner (next to the Opera House) was good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly good location”
Reviews.Author: jooleye
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from reunion trip to Venice we all stayed at the hotel , I had a wonderful visit and because I was with friends able to view at least four rooms. all different but consistently good most had baths and shower attachments though mine had a shower. Breakfast was good with awide continental selection. People say Venice is expensive but the hotel offers cocktails for 5 euro a lot cheaper than London and it was nice to return to the hotel and have a few drinks when your feet start to ache - be prepared to walk a lot!!! If you have booked a transfer to the airport please check your route to the pick up point we spotted a few frantic people lost and worried also the hotel marked the map slightly wrong and we were early and saves enough to check with hotels near the pier. This was for cresta which do not answer the phone and collect from as all unmarked pier near the hotel regina! Many might be alittle stressed by this and use either the public transport or book a taxi from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of staying here!”
Reviews.Author: GranZorro
Reviews.Content: After staying recently at this place, it is beyond me how they could have obtained their alleged 4-star official rating. The only four star element I could discern is the rip off pricing (about which later). The room was a disaster - very small, musty, confined. The bathroom was old fashioned. There is not enough closet space even for a few nights stay. Antique TV set. The physical facilities are trumped, however, by the demeanor of the front desk staff (a heavy set gentleman who lets his frustrations out on his guests). An example? Coming back from a heavy days sightseeing, his greeting was not "Hello, how are you?", but a curt "Check out tomorrow is at 11 AM". Even if you don't pay the outrageous rack rates of around 300 Euros (that's almost 420 US!) by getting a deal, avoid this place. Do what many savy travellers advise - stay at a nice, modern place in Mestre on the mainland for around 90-100 Euros and take the 15-20 minute bus ride into the main island of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel, in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: matthewgough
Reviews.Content: We're just back from three days staying here, and I can't recommend this hotel strongly enough. The location is excellent, being off a quiet side canal means it's very peaceful at night, yet it's a 10 second walk to the Phoenix Theatre and square, and 10 minutes from St. Mark's Square. The rooms are small, it's true, but they are beautiful: high ceilings, silk damask wall coverings, marble bathrooms. Furniture is slightly practical, but very functional, and the turn-down service is good. Breakfast is served in two lovely rooms on the ground floor - standard continental buffet - with helpful staff always keeping the coffee and tea topped up. We opted for the 'water taxi transfer' from the airport as advertised on their website. It's a little more expensive than just getting the vaporetto or a private water taxi, but MUCH more convenient and speedy. They do all the lugging of bags too, so if you're worried about heavy suitcases this is the best way to do it. Definitely worth the extra money. We'll certainly be going back to Venice, and will very likely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Approach”
Reviews.Author: Jim V
Reviews.Content: This is a great out of the crowd boutique Hotel. Arriving by water taxi allows you to exit the bost and enter directly into Hotel. This is great. The staff was excellent, friendly and helpful. Old building that has been upgraded very nicely. Full bar. we had paid for a room upgrade, and by viewing their on line pictures, we expected a little nicer. But this did not dampen our stay. It is out of the way, so a little difficult to find on first attempt. This also added to the fun of staying there. we highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgina18
Reviews.Content: Fairly convenient to St Marks Square but would have been hard to find lugging suitcases etc., room small but only staying one night. Staff helpful

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay since 2006, woud return again”
Reviews.Author: bhmmhm
Reviews.Content: Our ninth time together in Venice (we were each here before we married in 1953), our third at the Duodo. A fine value in contrast to outstanding 5 star Venetian hotels we had also enjoyed. Our room overlooking the canal was ready for us by noon (after an early morning arrival off a cruise), and Frederico was particularly helpful as before. Returning from Venetian ventures is like coming homre again. (If Duodo would upgrade from the plastic motel-like glassware in rhe bathroom?)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loubnasuccar
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for only one night, the hotel was a bit hard to find but it is within 5 minutes from st mark's square. i only have one complaint, the breakfast was really poor compared to the other 4 stars hotels during our trip to italy

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Normski99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night before sailing out of Venice. This hotel is very central and just a short walk from St Mark's Square. Our room was enormous and had a balcony over the canal, so we could watch the gondolas go by. Although we arrived early, our room was ready. We found it fairly easy to get our bearings and were well placed to visit a good deal of Venice on foot. We had the breakfast and it didn't disappoint. The only criticism was that although the bathroom was a good size, there was no shower - the bath had a shower hose, but there was nowhere to hang it. If you can rustle up the cash (110 euros), get a water taxi from the airport - it's such a fantastic way to arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Juliana B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in this month. I don't think it's necessary to get a water taxi to reach it, unless your suitcase is too heavy or if you have too much luggage, because there is a small bridge in the way, with some steps. From the airport, you pay 7 euros for the Vaporetto and, when you arrive in Venice, it's very easy to reach the hotel if you 've got a map in your hands (print it in a big size before the trip). Note: you don't need to pass through Piazza San Marco, there is a street in front of the station that you must take. Although it's much more fast and chic to get there by taxi, the price is high (150 euros), I think it's better to keep 100 euros for a gondola tour! The location is excelent, near Fenice Theatre and Antico Martini restaurant, near to everything. My room was very good, didn't seem to be old or decadent. The view wasn't nice, but it didn't make any difference for me. The bathroom was beautiful, with its rosso verona marble. I would love it if there was a shower... I don't like baths, but that's difficult in Europe... I also missed better lighting to do my make-up (but this is a failing in most hotels I've stayed). The staff was friendly, helped us with tips, making reservations... The breakfast was average, if you want squeezed orange juice or eggs, you must pay separately. At night, we liked to stay in the beautiful bar to have a drink. I would definitely return to this hotel, it is so charming, with the view of the canal... perfect for a couple, so romantic! So Venetian!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmmm
Reviews.Content: The Duodo Palace was a great place to stay with a stunning interior. It was bang in the centre of Venice, but far enough off the main streets that it was quiet - even tho we were there at carnevale time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet, Friendly and Charming”
Reviews.Author: NYCAnne
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the 450 year old Duodo Palace Hotel, located near Piazza San Marco (St. Mark's Square) for five days and enjoyed a beautiful room bathed in red and gold brocade. I found the staff to be professional, accommodating, and friendly. While my room did not have much of a view it was lovely and comfortable with good quality bedding. The first morning when I awoke to the Venitian hand painted fresco on the ceiling directly above me I knew I was somewhere special. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this hotel to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “we loved i and would return however.....”
Reviews.Author: AndyAuckand
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel for 5 nights and after one night in standard room requested upgrade as the room was so small. Very hard to find hotel initialy and with baggage we definately recommend water taxi to and from front door. We were not able to get wifi in our room and used one of the little downstairs lobbies which was ok. The hotel charged for wifi which is unusual these days. They did not charge us however due to the problems we had. Breakfast was ok but we thought charging 4 euros for a boiled egg escessive! Overall though, we loved this hotel and would return. We learned to live with its little quirks and the beautiful building, location & friendly staff more than made up for the complaints which were, on the whole minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saul552
Reviews.Content: We had a triple on the top floor and the view was great. Our room was comfortable and clean. The location was good too.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon - was good”
Reviews.Author: Tamsin F
Reviews.Content: Duodo palace hotel was pretty easy to find from San Marco vaporetto stop. Entrance into hotel was lovely (either from the small canal next to it or the main entrance on the street). The staff from the start were very helpful and friendly and conversed with us in italian and english which we enjoyed. Our room was on the top floor and was beautiful with spectular view across Venice. The look was antique which we liked and the bathroom was fine too. However the air conditioning (even though it was on maximum) was really not that great so we didn't sleep that well on any of the nights. To be fair though it was 38% which even the staff said was unusually high for Venice. We enjoyed the breakfast in the hotel and also had some martini's in the bar which were excellent. We would recommend this hotel to others, our one thing was really the problem with the air conditioning, other than that we really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and service”
Reviews.Author: velazquinho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, nice and with great service. Rooms are large enough and what you would expect from Venice. Getting here by boat adds to the experience. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Like2Travel12
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Duodo Palace Hotel. The location was decent, however I would say that the room was a bit average, even below average. Although it was clean (which is important), the room needed to be updated. It was very dark, and needed some renovating, just felt kind of outdated. However, the hotel staff was very helpful and polite. Would choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: RothherhamStu
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and Venice is very nice but so over expecive to eat and drink they have a captive audience they don't gave to serve nice food a one in a life time experience I think

Reviews.Title: “The best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: HB00763
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June 11. We had a fabulous room on the 5th floor (503) that was spacious and comfortable with views across the rooftops of Venice. The hotel is quite hard to find so be sure of your directions otherwise catch a water taxi (70euro) which will drop you at the front door. It might seem expensive but it is worth it ( and saves you wandering Venice aimlessly dragging bags like we did) plus you get a tour of the canals at the same time. The room we had was very large with a sitting area and a large bathroom and windows you could open for some fresh air. The hotel and rooms are very quiet and close to everything you need in Venice. The hotel has free internet and the staff were always friendly and the front counter staff particularly obliging. This hotel was a real highlight on our holiday and once we actually found it were more than pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Copter30
Reviews.Content: Our second stay: fresco ceilings in a superior room, great location quiet but near to everything, peaceful oasis after day of Venice! Nice breakfasts, excellent staff. Excellent beds. We will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: river21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. The hotel is ideally situated about 10 minute amble from St Marks Square. The staff are all very helpful and will arrange trips etc. We did an evening trip around the canals in a water taxi for 100euros but was worth it and lasted an hour. The one room we had was on the small side but having said that it was very clean and comfortable. A water taxi direct to the airport cost 100euro but this compares favourably with the regular waterbus. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was...just ok.”
Reviews.Author: knvna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. I have no major complaints but I would not stay here again. It says it is centrally located which is partially true. It is in the middle of the island, but it very difficult to find and any excursions you may want to take will be located on or nearer to the Grand Canal- a twisty turny walk about 10 minutes away. My major complaint and something I did not take into consideration pre-vacation is this: The hotel is located on a very small canal. Very few rooms would have a view of this. If you are in a room without a view your options for sitting somewhere and relaxing and enjoying a peaceful Venice night are very limited here. There is no restaurant with a view, no outside patio, no roof terrace. There is just your cavernous room or the hotel lobby to sit and hang out in which ends up being very boring or awkward. No place to sit and enjoy the night air and talk with others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find, But Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeM2
Reviews.Content: Small little hotel and tucked away in the streets of Venice and close to San Marco Square. Staff very friendlya nd helpful and common areas beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous with fresco's in each. Breakfast could be better, as it seemed all the eggs etc were A La Carte and additional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a golden wedding celebration”
Reviews.Author: davidjgower
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal through a travel agent friend but we would have enjoyed this anyway. Staff were attentive, rooms were comfortable, canal in May not malodorous at all, breakfast good, location superb, Venice wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dacarlq
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed in two rooms for one night and were very pleased. Charming hotel. Rooms are modest, but overall experience was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theEdwards_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay , lovely hotel and very good and polite staff- apart of beeing waken up by the maid chatting loud in the corridors .... lovely rooms and veru clean, breakfast is ok, not much of a variaty ...but very nice coffee . Our room was quite small but we had a great sleep overall . The location is great , just a short walk from everything but sill quieter than the very central ones. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Welcome Awaits at this Very Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fynn03
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this is the most wonderfully unique hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in, from walking through the quaint courtyard to the front door or arriving via water taxi from the canal, the warm welcome that awaits you from the reception staff was wonderful, and nothing could have prepared us for the quality and starndard of our room, with luxuary decor, furnishings and sumptuous bathroom (room 602) and our daughters room similarly indiviual furnishings with the addition of an original fresco dating back hundreds of years. The breakfast staff were warm and welcoming each morning as they served us tea or coffee, and the continental breakfast buffet choice couldn't be faulty for choice or quality. Our party consisted of 4 adults and our baby grandson, and although Venice is not the most pram friendly city we didn't experience any major problems in moving about the city from this very centrally located hotel. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the Duodo Palace to anyone and would certainly like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday and excellent hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: er65
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at this hotel which is very close to San Marco Square but in a very quiet area. We can recommend this hotel to everybody travelling to Venice. Room we stayed was very big and had nice roof paintings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel (centrally located, but away from the hustle & bustle)”
Reviews.Author: Nicks1234
Reviews.Content: We loved the central location, but fortunately the hotel is also located in a very quiet area and is VERY relaxing to come back to after a long day of walking (great air conditioning). The building is beautiful, and the rooms are very nice sized (we splurged this time and had a balcony overlooking the roof tops and the canal...gorgeous!). The morning breakfast buffet (included in our rate) was a very nice way to start the day with pastries, bread, meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, coffee, etc. (and for a relatively small extra charge you can order hot food, eggs, etc.). Even though it was expensive, we took the private water taxi (arranged by the hotel ahead of time, and docking directly at their lobby) on both our arrival at the train station (recommended unless you know your way around Venice...hotel can be hard to find on foot the first time) and on departure on the way to the airport (was so amazing to step in the boat directly from the lobby, and get a grand tour of Venice on our way out (which we videoed to show all our jealous friends)....getting to the airport only took 20 minutes, and they drop you next to the terminal!). The only negative about the hotel (and it was more of an annoyance than a real problem) was the shower. The bathroom/en suite was very nice, all marble and large, but the shower/tub had no shower door, no partial door (European style), nor even a shower curtain. Given that the tub was so narrow (impossible to sit comfortably, and difficult at times even to turn around while standing), and that the shower head was typical old-style Italian handheld model, it made taking a shower an adventure (and put water ALL OVER the floor). It wasn't a major issue, but taking a shower was not terribly relaxing or a way to unwind after a long day. I know this is quite common in some places in Europe (I have been to Europe dozens of times, and fortunately this design feature is slowly disappearing), but a partial door would have made the issue go away. Some of the other reviews seemed to have problems that we never experienced. We would definitely recommend this hotel (and stay there again next time in Venice).

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ruthNy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duodo Palace in Venice twice on our 25 day trip---3 days at the beginning and 2 days at the end. The room we were in # 607 was perfect---large with Venetian frunishings & best of all, a balcony overlooking the canal where we watched many gondolas pass by below. From 5pm to 6:30 pm many gondolas also provided singers. It was an amazing experience! When we left after 3 days, we requested the same room for our return stay. On our return, we were greeted by name. Room #607 was available & within 5 minutes of settling in, we received a complimentary bottle of procecco and 2 flutes. We enjoyed it on "our" balcony! The staff at the hotel was wonderful---they were always available and able to direct us wherever we wanted to go. Duodo Palace is about a 10 minute walk from San Marco Piazza & along the way are many shops with prices that are better than the shops closer to the Piazza. Take the private water taxi from the airport---it is well worth the money if you have more luggage than a light carry-on. We booked through www.Veneziataxi.com.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not the best room”
Reviews.Author: Darlene51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. Great location close to St. Mark's Square. Canal access made it convenient to take a water taxi to the train station on a rainy day. Staff was polite, but not overly friendly. We had an odd room on the fifth floor. We had a skylight in the ceiling for which you had to climb on the bed to open and close the blind. There was a pole in front of bathroom door and there was a very small shower, no tub. Unfortunately the elevator only went to the fourth floor. From the brochures, it appeared that other rooms may have been nicer. We found other guests in the hotel to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Skicrazed
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine hotel - truly deserving of its 4-star rating. The hotel is very well appointed with classical furniture while everything looks new or remodeled on the inside. the staff and service are excellent - first rate. extremely polite and helpful. We had a lovely room on the 4th floor, overlooking the rooftops of Venice and a glorious view of the Cathedral of San Marco, lit up at night. The only caveat - beware of their restaurant recommendation. Like other Venetian hotels, they are 'encouraged' to steer guests to A Beccafico, rated #3 on Trip Advisor. A mistake - I've already dissed that restaurant on another review. We would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: drkane
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, incredibly located in the very centre of Venice. This does mean it can be difficult to find food and drink nearby for reasonable prices. We had one of the smaller rooms in the hotel but it was still big enough, and well provisioned. The breakfast is excellent, and the bar serves reasonably priced cocktails (for Venice anyway!) for a lovely end to the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: koko123456
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, very central to all the sights and shopping - we utilized the concierge service to arrange transportation from the airport directly to the hotel, I would highly recommend this service for any first timers in Venice as finding the hotel on the winding streets of Venice with your luggage in tow could be a bit difficult (also its a beautiful way to first see the city - via a private water taxi). We had a canal view room and it was wonderful. The staff was great and very helpful - I would guess that they are more accustomed to guests staying for a night or two, as they only had restaurant recommendations for 2-3 places. The wi-fi is free, but only seems to work in the lobby area which is a bit of a drag. Overall, it was a lovely stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “i never write reviews............... but..... FABULOUS.....................................”
Reviews.Author: italia32
Reviews.Content: I in general, would never write (or read for that matter) a review...... but, i had to extend my experience with fellow travellers...... We happened to be sent to this Hotel.. being Duodo Palace..Venezia..... What was mean't to be only a couple of days stay, managed to be weeks.... We experienced professional and loving staff.... From Sandro, Francesco and Claudio greeting us with kindness and no effort spared whenever we needed anything... nothing to much to ask for... if they could do it... it would be done immediately....then to the hilarious and entertaining Nico and Raffaela, greeting us every morning.... Our coffee delivered with charm and again, whatever we needed, there before you... I had such an amazing time staying here that i highly recommend anybody travelling to Venice to please consider Duodo Palace as the Hotel itself is beautiful the staff are just AMAZING..... Thank you for making our stay that even more enjoyable..... Melisa and Victoria...... Australia

Reviews.Title: “We are saving straight away to take our family there.”
Reviews.Author: londontorome160511
Reviews.Content: We were greated by very friendly staff who made us feel immediately welcome, the rooms were very clean and roomy. The Hotel is quiet and the setting is a bit like a fairy tale with the Gondalas passing by the front door. We visited 8 cities in 3 different countries and for us this City and the Hotel stood out, thanks to all for making our stay such a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a dungeon for a room”
Reviews.Author: chocolatecarol
Reviews.Content: Expensive room and we weren't willing to pay for an upgrade since we were only staying the night. Our view was out onto a flat roof and the back of the building. It wouldn't have been so bad had they bothered to clear away all the cigarette ends outside. The bed was comfortable though and we got a good sleep as the room was so dark. Probably not worth staying here unless you are willing to upgrade to a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Pinarcan
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on reviews here. Its amazing location makes it a bargain. Very good service and staff. Don't expect the rooms to be luxurius but everything is very authentic. Breakfast not so rich. Good value for this tiny hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bulilrod
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed there during the Easter Weekend and had a wonderful time. Everyone was very professional and very helpful. They had great restaurant recommendations, were accommodating to our poor Italian skills, and made every effort to make our stay comfortable. The location was an easy walk to great shopping and the square. Next time we're in Venice we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Sublime!”
Reviews.Author: Peachey2
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful week end at this hotel. Staff were all so helpful and friendly. It was my husband's birthday while we were there, and they brought up a chilled bottle of Prosecco, without us even having to ask! They also organised a gondela trip with the only female gondelier in Venice, departing from their doorstep. Location perfect. In the heart of things, yet very peaceful. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous. Perfect Location, very helpful staff, drinks reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Berry001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2011 as a party of 8 people. Fantastic being dropped off by water taxi right by the door. Would recommend that for getting there from airport rather than vaporettas. Felt like royalty arriving. We were getting married in Venice and the staff were so helpful and obliging, and seemed to be that way to all guests. Helpful with directions, recommendations etc. Drinks in the hotel were very reasonably priced compared with outside restaurants etc. No cover or service charge for a start. Rooms were great, very clean and well serviced, breakfast was good though only cold buffet, but plenty, and fresh. All in all a great trip, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sam55Essex Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, however very tricky to find as the 'street' is not on any maps as it's tiny - it's easy to find once you get to Teatro La Fenice. Rooms were lovely and very clean if a little small. The only thing that wa missing was there was no Tea/Coffee making facility in the room which we missed. Only other thing was that although there were lots of TV channels, we could only watch CNN or BBC World News. Although we weren't there to watch TV, it is nice to be able to wind down watching TV when you have finished your busy day sightseeing. Staff at reception were very friendly - shame the same can't be said for the 'older' man who works in the breakfast room - very grumpy and very rude - does not like it if you and your partner ask for different drinks! (We did-every day!! It became quite amusing in the end! - For British visitors, he reminded us of Graham the counsellor on Jeremy Kyle Show!) Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice for continental breakfast or option to pay for cooked breakfast - we were happy with the lovely fresh croissants. The hotel is gorgeous and very quiet at night which is great and only a stones throw from St Marks Square and all the action. Highly recommended. The Hotel backs straight onto a canal which was lovely. We did the obligatory Gondola ride which was so romantic and had to be done even though it was expensive at 80 Euros (for 45 minutes). We would recommend getting a ticket for the Waterbuses - they are frequent and easy and if you get one to cover your trip, it makes life so much easier (we got a 3 day one when we got to Piazzale Roma from the airport)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshireEngland89
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel, friendly helpful staff, beautifully decorated rooms, location could not be better, would definately recommend and, if returning to Venice in future, this would be our preferred hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough For What You Get In Venice”
Reviews.Author: RuthyGlasgow Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Now that we are home after spending 5 days/nights in beautiful Venice and feel we know this city quite well, if I was to return I would not stay in the San Marco area. It is so very near the main attractions (which was why I choose it) but more expensive and wld advise anyone going, to stay in a more outlying area which wld be much cheaper and still within easy walking distance to St Marco, also the restaurants and trattorias wld be cheaper. I wld recommend the Castello area where you cld follow the main water side walkway to get to St Marco or the S Polo area near the Rialto bridge. The Duodo Hotel standard room that I booked and was shown to was very small and the window opened up to another wall 4/5ft away with no canal in sight so we opted to upgrade for another 80 euros per night to a bigger room with 2 windows looking down into a canal (room 100) which was much better. Francesco at Reception was the most helpfull of staff there on whom we relied upon, thank goodness he was there as helped us to decide what to do and where to go. He recommended the islands of Burano and Torcello which were beautifull and so glad we went. Thankyou Duodo for a good base and lovely time but just bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnFox53
Reviews.Content: I travelled in a group of 10 ladies and found the Hotel Duodo Palace to be a perfect hotel to enjoy the sights of Venice. We were picked up at the airport by a water taxi and arrived in style at the water entrance of the hotel. The hotel staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble for them. They recommended two excellent restaurants for supper meals and both of these proved to be outstanding. The bar in the hotel was good value for drinks and the free " nibbles" provided were a great extra. The breakfast was plentiful and there was always more tea or coffee available.The rooms varied in size but all were very clean and had all the facilities needed. The location was spot on and we were able to walk to all the attractions with ease. I would definately recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolTraveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this lovely hotel highly enough. It was perfectly located for all the major attractions. Lots of lovely restaurants in close proximity. It was our 30th Wedding Anniversary and we had been upgraded on a arrival to a great room which had a lovely fresco on the ceiling,a balcony which overlooked the canal. On a few afternoons when we came back for a quick seista we watched the gondoliers move down below us while in a following gondola there was a man playing an accordian whilst another sang...it just doesn't get any better We were also left a bottle of Prosecco on ice on our first evening which we were to tired to drink after travelling, the staff very kindly arranged to have this brought to our room the following evening. The hotel had organised a free trip by speed boat from the door of the hotel [this was a once in a life time experience, stepping from the reception of your hotel into a boat] to the glass factory on Murano. The breakfast was continental and was plentiful, the staff who served could not have been more helpful. The staff also on the reception did everything they could to make our stay a truly wonderful and memorable experience....I and my husband will most definately be returning next year

Reviews.Title: “faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathysam
Reviews.Content: this is a simply fantastic hotel. I cannot think of a single downside to it. Was a bit tricky to find in the first instance, but on arrival, this is forgotten. hotel is luxurious, rooms spotless with daily bedding / towel change. We were upgraded to a room with canal view and gondolas were passing regularly, some with the most fantastic singers aboard. staff cannot do enough to help you. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. drinks from the bar here include delicious cocktails and are very reasonable compared to the rest of venice. Hotel is situated about 5 mins walk from st marks square, palace, basilica, vaporetto etc but is far enough away for you to get a restful nights sleep. would definitely stay again with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: KimNeoh
Reviews.Content: We were a little lost in trying to get to the hotel - Venice has so many small passages that is pretty confusing. The hotel's plain facade belies its interior - it was gorgeous inside! A small but well decorated lobby , nice Italian furnishings to the rooms. The room really cant fit 2 mid-large suitcases. The bathroom was equally luxurious with nice modern fittings. The hotel is 5-7 min walk to the San Marco pier, and probably 5-10 mins to Rialto Bridge for food, shopping and entertainment. All in all, a little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DaSurpha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my girlfriend, and it was a very pleasant experience. I got offered a really good rate when I booked my flight tickets so it was a bargain as well! The hotel is very centrally located just next to the opera house, the room was very nice with a decent sized bathroom (with a tub). It was probably the quietest hotel room I've ever stayed in, slept like a baby! The lobby bar serves drinks and wine at a good price, dozens of restaurants in the area just a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations”
Reviews.Author: ddtowe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. 5 minutes walk from all the main locations; St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge, Galleria Del' Accadamia. Friendly helpful staff. In a quiet location so no noisy nights! Perfect spot to explore venice from and retreat to once your walked out!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: PRC_59
Reviews.Content: It is the perfect location - about 10 minute walk from all the major sites. It is nestled in a secluded section on the canal. Our bedroom was huge! We had a king size bed, a sitting area and in the entrance another couch and closet. The best part was being on the canal and seeing all the gondolas go by with people enjoying the beauty of Venice. We toasted them from our window every night before we joined them! The hotel is next to La Fenia de le Theater which is a landmark that everyone knows so we could always find our way home. The hotel personnel were extremely friendly and very helpful. We took a 2 hour private tour with Velma to see historic Veniza - it was well worth the money. She showed us several places that the Venician people like to eat. It was a delightful experience !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Vencice - Good value, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel based on recommendation from a travel agent. Booked early enough to get substantial discount from the rack rates, especially at the beginning of Carnivale. We stayed for 3 nights. Front desk...Outstanding! Very helpful and English was fairly good. Came with a free continental breakfast that included coffee, juices, variety of buns, meats, jams, cheese, cereal, etc. You only pay extra if you wish to have ham & eggs, etc. Hotel has WIFI. We were at the back of the hotel and was NOT noisy at all. Our room was the deluxe and exceeded expectations. If we go back, sorry make that when we go back, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All the great comments about this hotel really are true”
Reviews.Author: steveyh1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here w/c 21 Feb and all the fantastic comments on this site really are true. From the moment we entered we were welcomed in a professional but friendly and natural manner. The reception staff really are excellent. Our room (605) was plush and elegant. No great view but I wouldn't pay for a canal view as it is only a tiny back canal anyway. The girl at breakfast was also friendly and helpful. The chamber maids wee also extremeley professional. The breakfast was good with achoice of cereal, fruit, ham, croissants etc. The location was perfect, right between St Marks and The Rialto bridge so that you can keep nipping back to the hotel if you want for a break. Only a 5 min walk from St Marks boat stop even with heavy suitcases - study a map before you go and when you get near there's a small sign on a wall. Even the bar/snack prices are very reasonable - cheaper than most places in the city. Some hotels just seem to get it right and this is definitely one of them. Well done to whoever owns this hotel, it was a pleasure to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Dont hesitate just book it"”
Reviews.Author: thiswilldofine
Reviews.Content: Just returned after three day stay Thursday to Sunday with my wife as a 30th Wedding Anniversary treat.Great room 403 Junior Suite on the 4th floor with lovely rooms.Everyone of the staff were very pleasent and helpful..particular thanks to John in the bar for our early evening drinks.Faultless and great location.Only one tip is the small tables in St Marks and around the waterfront are used as "raised walkways" when the tide rises and water floods in to the Square.We got caught out returning to the hotel one evening and ignored the walkways and tried to walk across the square as the water appeared to be about 2/3 centimetres deep...we then found ourselves wading in about 6 inches of water and shoes/jeans bottoms saturated..our fault but if first time in Venice just beware.You will love Venice and need 2 days to see the main sites.The Basillica is unbeliveable inside.Water bus from the airport is easy and a greet way to get to San Marco square(about 7 minutes walk to the Duodo Place..yes it is hard to find at first..judt head for the theatre and then ask...a small yellow sign on the corner wall shows the hotel name and directions.If you want some peace and quite the hotel is so quite at night you have to stay to understand..having no cars in town does help.Thanks to Travel Rpublic for a great package deal and service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location,Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim160290
Reviews.Content: Recently visited duodo palace and had a wonderful stay. Was extremely close to saint marks square, literally five minutes away and so was able to go back and forth when we got tired. Water bus station is also very close which transports to every place in Venice and was extremely useful. Found a lovely pizzeria right next to the hotel which was reasonably priced. Room was upgraded as the hotel was informed that it was my 21st birthday. Room was very big with a canal view, bathroom was huge with a bath and a shower, including hairdryer and toiletries included. Room had a safe and a minibar. Was at first disappointed to see that at breakfast you had to pay extra for eggs and bacon but really enjoyed the breakfast that was provided including meats, cheese, croissants, toast, cereal and yoghurt and found no need to pay extra. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and once we checked out there was a safe storage area to leave our bags until we had to get our flight. They also provide a map of Venice to all guests. The hotel is right next to teatro la fenice, and in easy reach of a number of key sights. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JudeHayDerby
Reviews.Content: I had booked a trip to Venice with Co-op travel as a surprise for my partner. We were very impressed with the hotel and the stay was excellent. Location is central only 5 mins walk to St Marks Square (bring a map as its like a maze getting about on the island!). Staff were friendly, efficient and helpful, service was very good. We had breakfast included which was lovely, usual continental options but always fresh and plenty of it. Room (suite) was very nice, original fresco to ceiling, luxurious and lovely and clean. We would recommend this hotel if you are looking for good quality comfortable stay in central Venice. No gripes whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Worth double what it cost.”
Reviews.Author: Golfing_Robinsons
Reviews.Content: Ideal position, halfway between St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. First class accomodation, with friendly helpful staff who "go the extra mile". We had a junior suite which was beautifully decorated. Only downside is no tea/coffee facilities in room. Even though that is usually a particular bug-bear, the Duodo is so lovely I will forgive them. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful and friendly staff, what a find!”
Reviews.Author: Elodmester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Duodo Palace for 3 nights (22nd Jan - 25th Jan 2011.) The Duodo Palace is a mere 5 minute walk from St Marks Square and the ideal location to investigate Venice from. The staff were incredibly helpful and polite. Check in was hassle free and our bags were taken to our room for us. Rooms are spacious, clean and well presented. We stayed in room 502 on the top loor and had a lovely view over the rooftops. Do ask for a hairdryer from reception as they are more powerful. Do be aware that there are no coffee making facilities in the rooms. Breakfast was great. It consisted of tea, coffee and fruit juices to drink. To eat there was a selection of meats, cheese, rolls, bread, croissants, muffins, cereals, fresh fruits and fruit salad. On of the staff recmmended we eat at the Beccafico in Campo St Stefano as we were celebrating our engagement during our trip. Sooooooo glad we ate here. It is listed as the number 1 restaurant in Venice, on Tripadviser. We had the most fantastic meal here. The waiter was fantastic (well worth the 12% service charge.) If you go and you like seafood and shellfish you havee to have the mixed starter. It consists of 14 different starters and is â‚¬40 for two. Our meal came to â‚¬140 which equated to Â£119. This included a bottle of champagne and 3 courses each. Will definitely be back to Venice, the Duodo Palace and the Beccafico Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Duodo - What a gem”
Reviews.Author: jandaveandco Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed at the Duodo Palace for two nights 30/11 - 2/12. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we were very excited to be staying here. I found directions from a previous reviewer and they were brilliant, we found the hotel very easily and it was only a few minutes walk from San Marco. The check-in was easy and the hotel staff very friendly. Our twin room was lovely, very comfortable beds, plenty of wardrobe space and the bathroom was gorgeous! The view from our room was of the rooftops, but also the campanile at San Marco.the only downside we can think of would be the lack of comfortable seating when we returned to the hotel at night, this would have been great so we could have enjoyed a more leisurely drink. Oh and if you need the radiators turned up you need to contact reception as it's controlled from there!But that said the location was perfect, being only a few minutes walk from the Square, but also all the quaint little shops to browse in. The Vaparetto stop was easy to find, but we actually didn't find the need to use the vaparettos as everywhere was very accessible by foot. All in all we had a brilliant time. The breakfast was lovely, and everything you need to set you up for the day.The hotel staff were very helpful ,especially on the morning we were leaving, as it was high-tide and everywhere was flooded! They gave us directions to avoid the worst of the floods so we could catch the bus back to the airport!I would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others, and what can you say about Venice - BEAUTIFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LesDouglas Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard room which was fine, breakfast very good for continental type. About 5 mins walk from St Marks Square so location fine. Be careful of Service and Cover charges in restaurants,makes things overly as oppossed to just expensive. Recommend also Piccolo Martini restaurant on way to St Marks Square, quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place and a good location!”
Reviews.Author: CrisBrasilia
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. They took time to help us and answered all the question we had. We stayed in a magnificent room and the breakfast was excellent too. Very friendly place and a good location. We would definitely recommend Duodo Palace Hotel to others visiting Venice; great atmosphere! You have to stay there if you are going to visit this city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: eagle86
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Duodo Palace. As soon as we entered the reception area we knew the holiday had begun as the hotel definately, upon entering, had the wow factor. The reception staff were very helpful with advice of where best to eat, water bus times and even arranging free transport to Murano. Our room 107 was large and beautifully decorated in a rich Venetian style with a glorious canal view! There is no restaurant in the hotel, only snacks are available this however is not a problem as when you are in Venice you want to get out and about and the hotel being only a 5 min walk from St Mark's Square means there are lots of good restaurants about. The bar in the hotel offers a wide range of drinks and does great cocktails for extremely reasonable prices relative to the rest of Venice. One tip when going to Venice is before going in restaurants check what the cover charge and service charges are as these can be pricey. A good, relatively cheap restaurant close to the hotel is Piccolo Martini.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cpmderby Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay.upgraded to a deluxe room and worth every penny.located near all places of interest and lots of restaurants.December is a good time to visit as the crowds have all gone and the christmas atmosphere is superb,nightlife is quiet

Reviews.Title: “third stay there: says it all”
Reviews.Author: lixobart Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: exceptional location. Well run, peaceful. Worth paying for room upgrade. We've been 3 times now and last year had just basic room which was small and a little disappointing: this year had junior suite which was comfortable to be in. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGRBrussels
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located in a quiet street just 10 minutes from Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge and next to the Felice Theatre. So access is easy when arriving by vaporetta to San Marco or even private water taxi right outside the hotel. The Duodo Palace is a smart hotel, with a very nice lobby and excellent front desk staff. The rooms are well equipped with nice bathrooms and very clean. Even the breakfast was pretty good - which in Italian hotels is often not the case - and worth taking. Overall a great hotel and I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “From the DUODO PALACE HOTEL you can experience the sights, sounds and gourmet of Venice from this beautifully maintained”
Reviews.Author: toniksales
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! The DUODO PALACE Hotel is a wonderful place to stay while enjoying the City and its fine restaurants. From the first greeting of the Staff to the final Good Bye the atmosphere is simply delightful. The rooms are well furnished to blend with the frescos on the ceilings and to the proportions of the rooms (very spacious). The Staff are well informed and gracious. The location cannot be beat: its charming canal entry allows easy access to water taxies and Gondolas and the street door allows walks through the streets to uncover restaurants and shops off the beaten track. It is an easy walk to the Plaza San Marco and around the corner from the Theater district. We will definitely return and have already recommended the DUODO PLACE to friends that like to enjoy more than the typical tourist hotel. Rates are very reasonable and the Breakfast Buffet is substantial with a variety of items to suit different tastes.

Reviews.Title: “a great base”
Reviews.Author: apples99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew into Venice, and we stayed at Duodo Palace. The hotel does the job, the room is fairly large compared to European standards and puts out a decent spread for breakfast. The bathroom is nice, but for some reason, there is no conditioner. The hotel is above average and you are not going to Venice to sit your hotel room. Our biggest concern was how to get to the hotel from the Airport - whether we should be a private taxi or take the Alilaguna. If you are healthy and you can walk, by all means, do take Alilaguna. The directions they give on the website, is good and armed with a map, and some sense of direction, you will be in front of the hotel. We had no issues.. we made it to the hotel in one piece with our luggage in tow. We were stressed when we left, but take my word, private taxis are not worth it.. especially if they ask you for more since the hotel is not right off the main canal. All in all, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and its in a quiet little "square" and you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nikkileee
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and mostly helpful, although we found the porter at times could be more helpful than the actual front desk staff. Rooms were beautiful and spacious, including the bathroom. Location was wonderful, however be wary that this hotel is located in the most expensive areas of Venice for food/wine. As we were leaving before breakfast on our final day, staff packed us a small bag of goodies to take with us to the airport, which was wonderfully kind.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly, romantic, classic in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: dtbram
Reviews.Content: After our first long flight and first trip to Europe, we had several crises. First, we almost missed our flight in Madrid due to a boarding pass error. Then, although arrangements had been made with our financial institutions, we were unable to obtain euros or use a charge card. The fear of being in foreign countries where we had no money was extreme. Thanks to Sandro at Duodo Palace he assisted us in correcting the situation and assuaging our fears. He was patient with us as he explained directions, recommended a fantastic restaurant a favorite of the locals (A Beccafico), and helped with our transportation. Throughout our 16-day travels through Italy, Croatia, Greece, and Spain, there was none as kind and helpful as Sandro, a maestro in coat and tails. Our room, while condensed, was well appointed with lovely windows where we could hear gondoliers singing. Breakfast (included) was wonderful. It started my love of prosciutto, cheese, bread and fruit. Our only glitch was that when it came time for the water taxi to pick us up, it had rained the night before and was high tide. The water taxi was unable to get under the bridges. We had to move our own luggage to the Grand Canal. We do look forward to be returning to Venice, attending the theater (La Fenice is close by), staying at Duodo Palace, and be taken care of by Sandro.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lena1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here earlier this year and it was wonderful. I only realised on our most recent trip I'd forgot to add the review and really have to recommend it because it was amazing. The decor is beautiful, the location is good and easy to find if you take advice from on here. The staff are so friendly, polite and helpful (well all but one who was grumpy and had a very rude go at me for not giving him my keys when I ran out for two minutes to fetch a wedding bouquet on the day we renewed our vows! But I won't let him ruin my opinion of everyone else!). The bar and its cocktails are very nice too. I definitely hope to stay here again one day

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ending to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: VATravlnPair
Reviews.Content: Venice was one of our favorite cities and we just loved our hotel. Hotel Duodo Palace is perfectly located on a quiet canal near San Marco Square and other sites. The rooms were very nice (we loved the Venetian architecture and design) and bathrooms were large (only downside is that there is a tub with shower attachment, not a shower stall). Service is impeccable. In advance of our trip, we emailed the concierge several times to ask about tours and restaurants. Claudio always responded quickly and coordinated everything for us â€“ set up dinner reservations at Beccafico and arranging a private water taxi tour of Venice that left from the hotel (it was one of the highlights of our trip). We would definitely stay here again when returning to Venice, and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: talento7
