Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great venetian style and the rooms were spacious. The breakfast room lovely and well stocked. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant. A little difficult to find but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Average Rooms, Overall Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: kitschy
Reviews.Content: Duodo Palace is a perfectly fine hotel with an excellent staff -- it is, as others have said, hard to find, which makes it possibly not the best location for a first time visitor to Venice (as we were). Staff is lovely and extremely helpful. Rooms are average, nothing special but fine for European standards. Free WiFi. Excellent breakfast. It was hot while we were there and the A/C is controlled by the front desk - however, every time we made the request to lower temperature, the staff complied.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth The Cost”
Reviews.Author: Graley
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel by Water Taxi from the Airport. Albeit it was a bit pricey (120 Euros), it was well worth it, especially when you see countless lost people trailing through the streets with maps in hand trying to find their Hotel. From the minute we arrived the staff at the Reception were first class. They provided maps of the area and suggested areas to go to. The room that we had was on the second floor and overlooked the canal. It was a very spacious room with a high ceiling which was adorned with a fresco. No issues with the room whatsoever. It had excellent air conditioning and was always spotlessly clean. We advised the Hotel prior to arrival that we were celebrating our anniversary when we were there and they gave us a complimentary bottle of Proseco. The continental breafast that was provided is more than adequate, but did get a bit repetative after 7 days. However, I think the majority of people staying at the hotel were only there for a couple of days. What about Venice itself ? There can be no doubt that it is a beautiful city, but boy oh boy is it expensive! Whatever you would take as spending money normally for a week - double it for Venice. Average price of a beer - 8 Euros! That being said the cheapest place we found to have a beer and a glass of wine/cocktail - the Duodo Palace Hotel. Would I stay there again - yes. Would I recommend it to others - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service.”
Reviews.Author: travelbrat
Reviews.Content: We reserved and paid in full for a room at the Ruzzini Palace with 1800Hotels.com only to learn when we arrived at the hotel that the reservation had been cancelled by 1800Hotel's wholesaler. The Ruzzini Palace was sold out but the GM, Sebastini, quickly accomodated us at The Duodo Palace, an even nicer hotel that is closer to St. Marks AND he provided us a water taxi at no charge to take us from the Ruzzini to the Duodo. Our room was lovely and looked just like the pictures on their website - www.duodopalacehotel.com. The bed was comfortable and the A/C worked well. The bathroom was large and had a soaking tub along with the standard amenities and there were bathrobes and slippers for guests. There were lots of choices on the breakfast buffet including warm, fresh croissants. The location is good as it is close to both the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right near Piazza San Marco yet quiet, tucked away and not over priced”
Reviews.Author: weetbix75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Duodo Palace. The hotel is located around a 5 minute walk from Piazza San Marco but is tucked down a quiet alley which makes its location a quiet one but can also prove hard to locate (suggest printing out a map prior to arriving in Venice!). The room was spacious for European standards, though the ceiling was quite low. The bathroom was also quite sizable. Staff were pleasant enough and offered a standard level of customer service. Given the location and the fact we were in town on the night of one of Venice's largest festivals, the price was good - however the price did not include breakfast, we were offered this at an additional 15 euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but within easy walking distance to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: leedap
Reviews.Content: We recommend that you take a water taxi to the front door of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful with our many questions about directions to restaurants and sites. The top floor room was quaint but adequate. The bathroom was updated and very modern. The only difficulty was with getting the air conditioning to American standards. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We enjoyed the assortment of fruits, juices, breads, baked goods and cereals. The hot chocolate was yummy. We would definitely return to the Duodo Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: obryan144
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Duodo Palace Hotel in July 2010. We loved it. The hotel was clean, service was great, and rooms were beautiful. I would highly recommend the hotel to friends, family, and anyone planning to stay in Venice. We had an early flight on our day of departure, and the hotel staff even prepared a complimentary bag of food for us to take with us bc we would not be able to take advantage of the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - once you find it”
Reviews.Author: James E
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, excellent service, rooms were clean, but dark - even the lighting was dim due to the size of light bulbs - staff was very courteous, breakfasts were very good should publish GPS coordiates for the hotel location -- took 90 minutes after getting off the boat at St Marks to find the hotel -- they can also put a better map on their web site -- left by water taxi to airport and skipped all the transportation hazzle, recommend doing the same when arriving

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay and great service”
Reviews.Author: BradnMarianne
Reviews.Content: On the main island in close proximity to Piazzo San Marco. Rooms are beautiful and the service first class. Concierge is very helpful and polished. Great bathroom in a boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dougt1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here post cruise and loved it. Arrived around 10am, and was greeted by a very charming gentleman. As our room was not quite ready we were offered a free trip to Murano for a tour of the glass factory. When we got back our luggage had been placed in the room. Room was very nice. Some others had complained it was hard to find but we had no problem as we had printed a google map. Very close to St. Mark's square. A small square is close with nice places to eat. The staff guided us to our meeting point for our departure taxi by drawing it out on one of their brochure maps, and even packed us a breakfast bag because we had to leave before the restauraunt was open.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a secluded part of the canal but within walking distance of all the main attractions in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn3
Reviews.Content: Impeccible service with very friendly staff. Room was decorated nicely and very clean. Had a window that overlooked the private canal, very romantic would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed yet again”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: This is the third or forth time at this hotel. The hotel is well located near to St Marks Square. The entrance is marble and brass and feels very plush. The receptionists are always helpful and suffer my Italian without complaint. The rooms are very opulent and feel very grand. Breakfast is good by italian standards. I have recommended this to others who have been equally impressed

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem near St. Mark's Square on a back canal”
Reviews.Author: drswaim
Reviews.Content: Our "basic" room on the top floor was quite lovely with a great view over the tiled roofs of Venice. The hotel is a gem and has been beautifully renovated and maintained. The breakfast was plentiful and varied, with cereals, yogurt, fruit, cold cuts, cheese and various breads. The coffee and tea were excellent. The location was amazing - just a few zig zags to St. Mark's yet far enough away to be serene. The room had an old TV but it worked just fine and there were plenty of outlets to recharge our camera batteries and iPod. Internet was not free, a sore point for us. We booked through an internet booking site and got a great rate for such a central hotel - remember, it's Venice and expensive. You can book an expensive gondola ride right from the hotel - or just wait until one goes by and snap a great photo! Get a good map and you'll have no trouble finding this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Colleen61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the wonderful hotel while on our 20th wedding anniversary trip. It honestly was one of the best experiences I've ever had. Please do scroll down to earlier reviews to get directions to the hotel (it is tucked away behind St. Marco's plaza and not on a major street). It is quite simply charming, friendly and elegant. Our room was large and well decorated; the bathroom was modern and the hotel was spotless. I can't say enough about the friendly and efficient staff who work there. They have a solution for any problem, and are not condescending or rude, even if you are having difficulties, as I was with the hotel's internet one evening. Happy hour was a nice respite/stop after a day of sight seeing. The lounge area and breakfast rooms are intimate and elegant. Breakfast included fruits, cheese, meats, delicious croissants and coffee. I hope I am lucky to be able to stay at this wonderful hotel again some time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Beautiful City!”
Reviews.Author: m0nkiki
Reviews.Content: Upon landing in Venice my fiance and I decided we would take the Vaparetto directly to San Marco Square. We purchased the tickets at one of the airport ticket machines for 13 euros each. The vaperettos arrive hourly and although they can take a while to get to the final stop ( San Marco Square) it was particulalry easy. After a short while of suitcase lugging my fiance and I finally arrived at this hidden, little hotel much to our relief. Although it's location is somewhat secluded, we found it to be central to all the main sights and attractions, while maintaining a quiet ambience to retire to at the end of the day. After arriving we were warmly greeted by friendly staff, showing us to our small but comfortable room. The room was spotlessly clean, and although we did not have a frescoed ceiling this did not make a difference to our stay at all. Breakfast was of a continental style and we happily tucked into croissants, toast, cereals, youghts, fresh fruit and coffee everyday ( the coffee is particulalry recommendable) all of which we enjoyed. We later booked a Gondola trip through the Hotel, which we found to be really good value. We shared our boat with another couple which worked out at 25 euros per person for a 45 minute ride. Other Gondoliers were charging higher prices, so this is definately recommended. We also enjoyed a glass of Prosecco in the hotel bar which we felt was great value at only 3 euros a glass. The city overall is expensive and my fiance and I did at times feel ripped off at some of the restaurants. We would recommend checking some of the cheaper restaurants on trip advisor first the Omnibus Restaurant close to the Rialto Bridge was great for pizza and good value too! Many of the eaterys will happily charge you cover charges, 12 % service charge and make you pay 6 euros extra for a plate of chips, so be warned! Overall a charming hotel in a wonderful city, do not hesitate over booking!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,well situated”
Reviews.Author: manofgwent
Reviews.Content: Smart, exceptionally clean hotel next to all tourist hot-spots. Outstandingly helpful and polite staff, even when dealing with an extremely rude "gentleman" who was having a tantrum one day at reception. Breakfasts were very good, but bedroom we had was very small and cramped and not at all as advertised, even in the information provided in the hotel itself. The hotels own leaflets say that ALL rooms have this or that feature which is untrue. The room was not in keeping with the rest of this excellent hotel. For its position and quality, this hotel is superb value and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and elegant hotel close to the Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: furryc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Duodo Palace and would highly recommend it for a stay in Venice. Well worth a stylish arrival by water taxi to climb up in to the hotel entrance and be both assisted and greeted by such charming and friendly staff. The hotel is elegant and centrally located in the San Marco area but tucked away in a quiet location so a peaceful night's sleep is guaranteed. The rooms are clean and relatively spaceous, breakfast was continental and very good quality food and all the staff are very friendly and helpful; especially charming and informative is Francesco the Concierge. The hotel is close to the Fenice theatre which is well worth a look around and I would also recommend booking a walking tour and boat trip prior to your departure from home as we found this a good way to orientate yourself and to further decide exactly which venues and areas were worth further investigation. Wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again should we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Craigewan
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a great area, literally 200 yards from the world famous Fenice Opera House. Very central for all the sights - San Marco, Rialto Bridge etc., etc. From the very moment we alighted from our water taxi (must do) into the hotel we were made most welcome. All the concierge staff were very helpful with information, booking trips and restaurants. Rooms were spotlessly clean and very quiet even if we were on occasion awakened by the dawn chorus of the peeling of bells which can be heard throughout Venice. Breakfast was excellent with a selection of cereals, fruit juices, hams, salami, cheese, fresh criossants, toast etc., etc. Although we did not use the hotel bar (we were out all the time) it was reasonably priced. All in all a very pleasant stay in Venice and a memorable stay at the Duodo Palce.

Reviews.Title: “Three lovely days in a super hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: LindaCSwadlincote
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a super break with my mom (75yrs young,) so wanted to be central to all the sight of the San Marcs area. I was so impressed with my self for picking this hotel from all the reviews I had read about others. Could'nt believe my luck. Beautifully clean and comfortable, our room and bathroom were immaculate. All the staff were so polite and friendly. Lovely continental breakfast,( yummy hot croissants and honey.) Found the hotel with no problems due to great directions from another guest on trip advisor. No 5 bus from the airport to Plaza Roma, No1 vaporetto (water bus) to first stop at San Marcs.Then walk up Calle Valleresso, by the Monaco Hotel. The street ends at a T junction, turn left then immediately right to continue up Frezzaria.This street has a sharp left turn, just follow it and you will come to a bridge. Go over it and Calle Minelli is next on the right. The hotel has signs here. Bought our bus and water bus ticket on line for the three days beforehand. Just took the paper work to the desk at the airport to get the tickets. These are scanned at the machines every time you get on the water busses, as often as you want during your stay. Wonderful !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel hidden away”
Reviews.Author: Hack_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much thanks to the wonderful location, about half a minute from La Fenice, the exceptional quiet (with only a passing gondola to break the stillness), and the friendly staff. Francesco the concierge was particularly helpful. All warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: CadUk
Reviews.Content: We had forward planned the route to the hotel and fortunately found it very well. On entering it was very impressive with lovely dÃ©cor and style. The staff were very helpful, they provided a map and marked places to visit across the whole of Venice as well as places to eat. We were shown to our beautiful room with a high slating ceiling, wooden beams and luscious red dÃ©cor (very Venetian) We had a view across the many roof tops and you could look down and see the canal entrance to the hotel. The en suite bathroom was very spacious with a lovely marble sink area and good shower. Our first evening exploring Marks Square and the surrounding alleys caused us much confusion on getting back to the hotel. Yes we got lost a number of times but it was all part of the experience of Venice â€˜Get Lostâ€™! Breakfast at the hotel was great; there was plenty to choose from alongside a great cappuccino or coffee. The breakfast area is fairly small with about ten tables of two. There was one occasion we had to come back to get a table over the 4 days we were there but it was literally a five minute wait. We would definately reccommend the superior suites at the Duodo Palace and would return. The places we would recommend in Venice are: The Basilica - just beautiful! The Dogeâ€™s Palace â€“ It is like a step back in time, fantastically stunning painted ceilings, rooms and art works. The history is also very interesting. Rialto Bridge - and local markets Gondola Ride â€“ We passed many men trying to sell us a gondola ride but really didnâ€™t feel the trueness of it, a bit like a group of lads trying to make an easy buck. We happened to come across a gentleman on the 3rd day that was slightly older with his boat stationed on a small canal. He seemed very genuine and friendly all dressed in his attire. It was a lovely experience which took us on a tour of the many famous buildings and the Grand Canal. It cost us 80 euros for about 45 minutes which I think is the average cost. Carpaccioâ€™s Restaurant â€“ Beautiful, fresh food, good wine and friendly service. We went here for our anniversary meal. Places we wouldnâ€™t recommend: Harryâ€™s Bar â€“ The worst made Belliniâ€™s I have ever seen and value for money doesnâ€™t come close. Disappointing atmosphere as well â€“ sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful of Wotif Mystery booking at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingPococks
Reviews.Content: Having visited Venice 4 times previously, we were very excited about staying in a 4 star hotel. We have used wotif extensively and have NEVER been treated as an inferiour booking, however all was to change at Duodo Palace. Our 2 rooms while being next to each other (which was fantastic for keeping an eye on our teenagers) were absolutely tiny, no beautiful ceiling as promised, no chair or desk, just the bed and the shower scalded all 4 of us! A VERY dissapointing 3 night stay, be very careful of the mystery booking in Venice, these are the rooms they can not normally sell.(The staff would normally stay here I think) In hindsight we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: kilcoy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, no criticisms at all. Would definitely stay here again - now that we know how to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful centrally located hotel, courteous service and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: arty_fish Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, in a standard room. Service was delightful and courteous. Room service efficient and prices of cocktails reasonable. Decor of rooms sumptuous in an old world way with fabric hung walls. Marble bathroom was spotless. Didn't have breakfast in hotel preferring to have capuccino and panini out. Conveniently located near to Piazza San Marco and Academia and Teatro La Fenice literally round the corner. Didn't see any sign of the gym/swiming pool facilities but we weren't there for that. Would certainly recommend for its location and courteous service and standard of rooms, plus excellent price obtained via Octopus Travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great once we found it!”
Reviews.Author: catb80
Reviews.Content: We arrived at low tide, so we were unable to water taxi to the front door (or at least that's what we were told by the driver). Instead, we got to drag our luggage through San Marco Square. The hotel is tucked in a corner off some side street about 5 mins from the square. A few locals we asked couldn't even help us with the address. The hallways were pretty plain and sterile, but we were pleased when we arrived in a beautiful room with a bottle of Champagne waiting for us! Smaller bathrooms than what we'd experienced in Florence or Rome, but overall very nice accommodations. The front desk staff was very helpful in arranging transportation to the airport, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet hotel, well-located for all the main sights”
Reviews.Author: DorsetDweller
Reviews.Content: Hidden away in a tangle of backstreets, and on a small canal, this hotel is very quiet, yet in a great location for walking to all the main tourist attractions. The staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable, fairly large, and delightfully decorated with restored frescoes painted on the ceiling. All definitely 4-star except perhaps for the breakfast which could have offered more variety. The only difficulty is finding the hotel in the first place! Fortunately we'd read other people's reviews so knew to head for the Theatre Fenice and then ask for directions - which worked but we got lost a few times. If you can possibly find/download a map with Calle Minelli on it before you travel, then I'd strongly recommend that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: acn0202
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duodo Palace on a "3 nights for 2 " package and were given a lovely large room on the top floor - view over the rooftops and glimpse of adjacent canal; very peaceful.Room was very clean and bathrooms well stocked (but only simple hairdrier attached to wall, useless) . A little cold for November, we had to ask for heating to be turned up. Good breakfast very fresh rolls etc don't expect more in Italy. Fresh squeezed juice/eggs for a supplement if you want it. Very helpful concierge who twice booked us tickets for evening opera (highly recommend) 3 Tenors and Love Duets. First evening dinner close by Vino Vino recommended by hotel - quite good and not too expensive. Hairdressing salon next door. Not difficult to find hotel as v close to Opera House and a short walk to St Marks and vaporetto. No internet in rooms but free use of computer in lobby adjacent to bar. Hotel has its own canal side dock so arrive in style by water taxi!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and charming stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsjames0376
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Duodo Palace earlier this month and it was inredible. True, true, the rooms were small and it was difficult to find, but that is true of all hotels in Venice. True of many hotels in Europe really. So don't let that put you off this beautiful palace. Our room was nice and well-furnished. The hotel was amazing and the staff could not have been more friendly. I just wish I had stayed for more than two nights, and that I could have afforded one of the deluxe rooms or suites. We will definitely be saving up our pennies to return on our next visit to Italy. Highly recommended. Venice is expensive, but just be smart and avoid eating and drinking near tourist attaractions. You'll get more value for money and a better experience if you follow the locals. Just like anywhere else in Italy. I wish I'd known in advance that you can book your boat bus tickets online to save money. So try to do that if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & a beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Bilbo1london
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located near St Mark's Square. The staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us a map and telling us the best places to go. The room was clean and had a great mini bar which was not too expensive compared to the rest of venice. The cocktails in the bar were great. Breakfast was a little disappointing, with dry rolls and a small selection of continental items. If you are going to Venice make sure you wear flat shoes and beware of the rain! Once it rains Venice starts to flood and you are bound to get wet.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: valambhiajn
Reviews.Content: As much as I have read the rest of the reviews, I have to say that overrall, this Hotel is overhyped for what it really claims to be. The rooms are clean, but small and dimly lit. Mosquitoes are absolutely everywhere in the room and trying to sleep at night was a nightmare, even with Pest repellents. I'm sorry to have to burst the bubble but if I had to stay in Venice again, then I would recommend La Commedia or Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently situated for all Venice's attractions”
Reviews.Author: sp1953
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 3 minutes walk from the Venice Opera House on the Calle Minnelli - warning it's not marked on most maps. Takes about 10 minutes from St Mark's Square. Rooms comfortable but those superior rooms on the top floor are dark. Breakfast is fresh and plentiful. Special mention of the reception staff who are incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelpony
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Great hotel, only a 5 minute walk from the St Mark's Square vaporetto stop. Great sized rooms and bathroom - complimentary toilettries, hairdrier, bath and shower, air con, tv. Slightly faded elegance but very clean and comfortable. When booking, ask for a room overlooking the canal - gondola's go by all day and in the afternoon/early evening, they sing and play the accordian which is lovely and to adds a great atmostphere. Receptionists all speak very good english and are very helpful and there's a nice bar too. Breakfast had a good choice of the usual continential breads, cheeses, meats, fruits etc. Only a 10 minute walk from St Mark's Square and from the Rialto Bridge so great location - the opera house is just round the corner too. Really nice local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: ToandFromPDX
Reviews.Content: After some confusion and multiple uncomfortable encounters with the staff, they allowed us (2 adults, 3 children) to stay in 2 rooms. After that everything was fine but the experience kind of ruined the stay. Rooms were small but nicely renovated and clean. Hotel is located off the beaten path but still close to St Marcus and a small square with some nice rstaurants. The lobby is small compared to other hotels we encounterd in Venice so don't expect to hang out there at all. The hotel has no restaurant which I expected in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CMBrad
Reviews.Content: We went here for a low cost honeymoon and was recommended by the travel agent. We had a great time as the staff were polite and professional and it was very clean. The hotel was close to all the sights although we had trouble finding it from St marks Square when we first got there but it was very late at night. We would recoment paying for a water taxi if you don't want to be walking far with your cases. Venice is a lovely place and would love to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GARYDOT
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for it's near most of the best places of interest, about 5mins walk to St. Marks Square and just a little more to the Realto Bridge. To get to the Hotel at first can be a nightmare, a Water Taxi is the best option but a little pricey so if your on a budget find directions form Alilaguna Water Bus which you can get with a few minutes walk from the airport and takes you to St Marks for just 13Euro's each. The Hotel is an old Venetian Palace with its strange lay out of rooms going off in different directions up and down stairs, our room was not one the the best, it didn't have the ornate period ceiling like most of the others and was quite small but had a lovely marble bathroom. It was always kept clean and the staff were very helpfull. All in all we had a great stay as Venice is such a very special place to visit with all its history. I hope this review will help you in your decision. cheers GARYDOT (Sheffield)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Would stay there again, no doubts!”
Reviews.Author: dmackay41
Reviews.Content: We picked this Hotel after looking at numerous hotels on this site. We arrived by water taxi, which is the best way to go. After a very fast check-in and a complimentary map of the area, we were assisted to the rooms with our luggage....and then we went to explore. Hotel itself is lovely and clean. The staff are very friendly, efficient and a great command of the English language. Rooms were very quiet and best nights sleep I had for ages abroad. Breakfast was included and was fresh, tasty and plentiful. As I said, I would stay here when I return to Venice. Don`t look elsewhere.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CarrieG15
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 3 nights in Venice staying at the Duodo Palace Hotel. What a lovely Hotel, and in such a great location. Staff were very friendly and the hotel was lovely and clean. Venice has got to be without a doubt the best city we've ever visited. We got married at the Town Hall while we were there, which was totally romantic. Only downside is the ridiculous prices - but as it's somewhere you tend to only go for a few days, you've just got to put it to the back of your mind and enjoy!!! Gondola's are very pricey, but it's one of those things that you've just got to do!

Reviews.Title: “stay here”
Reviews.Author: almg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two great days in Venice. Highly recommend this hotel, location, staff, rooms, breakfast all excellent. I would urge everyone to buy travel passes on line before you go from Venice Connected, our 48 hour unlimited travel cost 21euros each. You collect them from the airport and take no 5 bus to Piazzale Roma then line 1 or 2 vaporetto to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Me and my Boyfriend stayed at this hotel after reading the good reviews, well all information was right the Hotel was lovely ,staff very friendly and very good location. would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice unexpected pearl”
Reviews.Author: diego_cla
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Duodo Palace one night for a romantic weekend in Venice. Booked as it was one of the cheapest in the S.Marco's zone, we were expecting a cheap rough hotel. Despite our expectations, the hotel was great, clean, with good rooms. The service was nice and the staff very nice. The breakfast, expected to be poor reading the other reviews, was nice and complete for a continental standard. Plus: location is great! 5min walk from S. Marco and still in a very quiet zone, facing La Fenice Opera House. From 4th floor the view is amazing, most landmarks can be spotted. We recomend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend at the start of Feb and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was lovely and true to the photos. We booked a standard double, but our room looked a little bigger then the other traveler photos (room 208). The bathrooms are new, large and clean. Shower is a lil annoying for the tall (not me) as it is a bath attachment and the hook is not that high but the power is very good and there was always lots of very hot water. They have shower caps and shampoo etc and even had travel tooth brushes. In the room there was a minibar and TV and the bed was very comfortable. Our room had a very high cealing which was beautifully painted. We found no problems with noise and were never disturbed by housekeeping even when we forgot to put out the sign. The breakfast was a good continental - bread, pastries, cheese and meats, fruit and yogurt, juice and coffee. There was no one in the bar area in the evenings that we saw while there but it was Feb. and not busy. However we did get back after dinner one night and felt like a drink and the person manning reception was happy to serve us once we charged to the room. The location of the hotel is excellent. 5 mins to St. Marks square and to the Vallaresso water bus stop near St. Marks. For directions when coming from the airport w got the bus to Plaza Roma (2.50 euro) then vaporetto to Vallaresso (1st stop marked as St. Marks) This was a lovely trip up the grand canal, then we walked over the lil bridge to our left and walked up calla valaresso (by Monoco hotel) This street ends at a T junction, but turn left and then immediately right to continue up Frezzaria. This street has a sharp left turn but just follow it and you will come to a bridge. Go over the bridge and you will see Calle Minelli as the next right turn (the hotel has signs here) The hotel is just down on the left. Took us 5 mins and was no trouble (though as with everywhere in Venice try packing light and wearing comfortable footwear as there is lots of walking) At 300 euro for the room for 3 nights I thought it couldnâ€™t be beat, Would definitely recommend and return myself

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bealeys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a romantic treat on our fifth wedding anniversary and were not dissappointed. The location is great - literally a couple of minutes from St Marks and about 10 from Rialto Bridge. It was so easy to get around from there. We chose to get a water taxi direct to the door as we arrived late at night which was a bit of a splurge at 65â‚¬, but we are glad we did as although it's only a few minutes from the Vaparetto, there are lots of little streets to navigate through, which is fine in the day but we just wanted to get to the hotel at that time of night. The hotel will book one for you if you like, but we decided to get one when we arrived next to the vaparetto in P Del Roma On arriving at the hotel, We were greeted by very helpful and friendly staff - in fact all the staff we came across could not have been nicer. I had also emailed them previously before we arrived to ask a few things and they were so helpful, we couldnt fault them The rooms were spotless and although you dont get much of a view the hotel is charming with lots of character and tradition, yet with modern ameneties We had read some iffy reviews of the breakfast but we were happy with it - you wont find a fry up, but a generous continental spread which filled us up for our day of walking around Venice Our return flight wasnt till late evening and the hotel is happy for you to leave your luggage to collect later at no cost so you can make the most of the day. We had a great time in Venice and the hotel certainly lived up to our expectations and more - we would definately recommend and go back again if we get the chance

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ollocks
Reviews.Content: Just had a great two days in Venice staying in the Duodo Palace Hotel. We found the hotel perfect for our needs, the room was large and well furnished overlooking the canal the bathroom large and more than adequate. Overall the hotel was extremely clean and very well maintained, the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and I would not hesitate to stay there again and would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Charming rooms”
Reviews.Author: khabster
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location- 5 minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The rooms were very charming, with Italian decadence. High ceilings, colorful decor. The staff was very sweet. They even brought us a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. The only problem was that it was hard to find- this is the case with all things in Venice, though. All the streets are small and so the maps aren't very helpful. The best way to reach the hotel is to take the public vaparetto to St Mark's stop and then walk about 5 minutes. It's 6 Euros per person, which sure beats the price of a water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjm2279
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, the location was very central. I emailed the hotel to ask for a map as I had read it was hard to find, but I had no problems. It was about a 5 -10 minute walk from St Marks Square. The hotel will probably reccomend a water taxi (Ok if you want to spend 100 euro), but its just as easy to walk too. The rooms are quite small, and dark, but clean and tidy. The staff were lovely and helpful, and the breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is wonderful and so is the Duodo Palace”
Reviews.Author: TRP1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my wife (double room) my daughter and sister in law (twin room) and would rate this probably the best hotel for ambience and friendly professional service I have ever stayed at. The rooms were luxuriously furnished and finished, and for hotel rooms quite spacious, we had a great view over tiled rooftops. The reception area also very tastefully decorated, I almost expected to see Audrey Hepburn sweep through on her way to her room. We had 2 different concierges during our stay who looked the part and were very helpful and professional. They both directed us to some great eating places in the area. The continental breakfast was fresh and tasty and the waitress service was spot on. Not sure of cost my sister in law paid - always a bonus! The position is great for exploring the lanes around San Marco and Rialto - you can get nicely lost, but not too lost! One tip if you can afford it, catch a water taxi from the airport or station, the difference between being delivered to the canal front door against dragging suitcases through the back lanes of Venice is well worth it, as is the ride into Venice against a Vaporetto

Reviews.Title: “It was just as we hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: BrianandElla
Reviews.Content: We travel ALOT all over the world and are quite demanding of the places we stay in and this little gem was all it advertized itself to be. We had no info about it save various website info & pics, as well as others' reviews. We were not disappointed. 5-10 mins. walk to S. Marco, quiet, ultra-clean, everything in working order, modern, beautifully designed. A great spot for romantics :-) We'd easily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: binky_7
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a water taxi direct to the hotel, and shown to our room 307 which had a balcony and there were compliementary wine and fruit awaiting us. All the staff were very nice and helpful and during the day it was lovely to sit on the balcony and watch the gondielers go past singing etc. The breakfast was fine and normal for europe hotels. Would definately stay there again. Very close to St Marks Square and the rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: MariettaGA
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with two other couples and were ending our cruise in Venice. This hotel seemed to be a good option for us. Small, located not too far (five min walk to St Mark's) and the staff was responsive to our requests. Whole hotel is non-smoking. We took a water taxi (120 euros) to the hotel and the staff was ready and waiting for us. Our rooms were not ready yet so we went out to begin exploring Venice. When we came back our bags were in our rooms. Our room was very very small and had a step down to the actually room and two steps up to the bathroom. If I was to stay here again, I would be very specific about the room. Others in our party had a flight of stairs to climb and the third couple had to have a room with no stairs. Once that was all worked out it was fine. The room was very clean with plenty of hot water. No face clothes so if you need that bring it. Lots of airconditioning too. The concierge was excellent! Ask and they took care of it. There was a computer for internet use by the guests and it was pretty good speed too. Breakfast was not included but available for 15 euros. It was OK; a typical continental cold breakfast. BUT nothing is cheap in Venice. I would consider staying there again. The hotel was located off a tiny street very near the Fenice Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, No View From Room if You Want That”
Reviews.Author: shimmer
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations for european hotels. The location is great for getting to all the Venice attractions. The only weird thing we found was that the front desk keeps your room key every time you leave the buidling - this was a little odd - like always knowing where you are. But otherwise, the room was lovely, except that the window looked out at a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “A conveninet place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuff-Ind
Reviews.Content: As a part of our trip to Italy we stayed in Duodo during our 2 day stay in Venice. The place is wonderfully well located within a short walking distance from all major attractions. Reaching it can be a little bit of a trouble because of the small lanes but its not too bad if you follow the map that is provided on the website. The place is exactly as shown on the website so that is fair. Though I liked the place and loved Venice, a few things left us wishing for more. We had taken 2 rooms for 4 adults and one of the room provided was really tiny. It hardly had place to move and as per the front office no other rooms were available. Suggest you ask them for the big sized room while making the booking. The staff was ok. The front office could have been friendlier. However, the conceirge was helpful and was of great assistance and the person who helped us with the bags to the room also deserves a mention for cheerful service. The breakfast is something that Duodo management should look into. The food was just about ok and when we wanted to place an order for eggs, the staff told us that she cannot make it since she was the only person available to serve. This is when we were willing to pay extra for eggs. I feel the winner for Duodo is its location and lovely interiors and I would really like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bullislander
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel I had some misgivings especially about being able to find it. I now have no misgivings at all. We took the Aliliguana from the airport and got off at San Marco. Took about 10 minutes total to find the hotel due to me doubting my map reading skills. If I went with my gut feeling it would have taken less than 5 minutes. Room was clean, modern, and good size. Staff was very helpful. Best part was location, location, location. We would without a doubt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Duodo Palace Mar '08 and was really hard to find but turned out to be a great hotel. The room was ok but had really low ceilings. Other than that...the hotel was nice; front desk was helpful and seemed to have 4 star ammenities. It's really close to the Piazza San Marco and Ponte Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JULIESOMERSET
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel in a perfect location 2 mins from St marks -and the grand canal - incredibly difficult to find, especially if you arrive at night as we did. However the lack of public rooms i.e there is no restaurant or bar to speak of -lets it down and I would have to call it a 3 star not a 4 - it is a real shame that there is nowhere to have a night cap after a hard day and catch up with fellow guests -also the worst hairdryers ever - ladies pack your own! Staff friendly, welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holfans
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a four day break in Venice. We took the water bus to San Marco and it was then a simple 10 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The staff were helpful, polite and welcomimg. The continental breakfast was plentiful. Our room had a balcony which overlooked the canal. All the sights were within easy walking or waterbus reach. Overall a wonderful introduction to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WolverhamptonMissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have just returned from a weekend in Venice and it was wonderful. We stayed at the Duodo Palace and we had a beautiful room with a balcony and views over the canal. The room was very spacious and decorated in a traditional venetian style. The staff at reception and the bar area were attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We had read some reviews that said the breakfast was not good but we can honestly say it was one of the nicest continental breakfasts we have had with plenty of variety. There was an additional menu for cooked items but these were expensive. The hotel is positioned in a perfect place for the main sightseeing i.e. St Marks Square and The Rialto Bridge but always ask for a map from reception because it takes a little getting used to because the streets look the same. We had a private water taxi from the airport straight to the hotel which was really lovely but they are expensive 100 euros one way. The restaurants were all pretty good and all the meals we had were very nice but they can work out expensive especially if drinking alcohol as well. If we decide to go back to Venice we will definitely stay at the Duodo Palace again it was impossible to fault it in any way and we really enjoyed it. We hope this review has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with Duodo Palace”
Reviews.Author: cinderella10195
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay at the Duodo Palace after our Cruise returned to Venice. We had to pay alot (130 euro ) for the water taxi to get us their from the port because it is down a canal that is hard to get to. The front desk were not friendly. Our room faced the back of the hotel with no view. Upon checkout in the morning we were told we owed 40 euro for the Contienental breakfast that was listed as free on the menu in the room. We tried to argue the point that breakfast we ordered was on the free colum on the menu but to no avail they did not back down and we paid it so we could make our flight home. Would not recommend this hotel. unfriendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly central”
Reviews.Author: Jane78Venice
Reviews.Content: We landed in San Palo airport @ 9pm & arrived at Duodo Place Hotel around 10.30 pm. Our room was really nice & being on the top floor (room 403) we had great views of the city. I would recommend this hotel due to it being so central, competitively priced & they were most pleasant & accommodating. While we had to check out at noon they minded our bags until we were ready to collect them to fly home later that evening. The mini bar can be quite expensive however so is the rest of Venice. I would return to this hotel again. A tip on finding the hotel when you get off the Valporetto Bus Boat. Go straight down the street passing Harry's Bar, keep going straight down the winding streets until you get to the Theatre Square (Fenice Theatre)...the hotel is on your right down an alley way (10 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice facility”
Reviews.Author: ChewableFood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is between and a little west of St. Marks and the Rialto. An easy 8 minute walk to each. I had their cheapest room which was tiny but the bed was comfy and the bathroom appeared recently refurbished with new fixtures and tile (There is a detailed floor plan in the hallway showing the fire exit routes allowing easy comparison between your little room and the rooms of the folks who forked it out). The lobby is elegant and the concierges were helpful on multiple occasions regarding restaurant selection and travel planing. One drawback: Orbitz said breakfast was included but the hotel said it was not. This seems to be a repeating problem between them an Orbitz because the concierge showed me a letter from his boss stating that the front desk should inform Orbitz customers that breakfast is not included. The breakfast hiccup aside, the hotel is very nice, well situated and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: SMathew
Reviews.Content: The Duodo Palace is very close to San Marco. If you arrive with big luggage it's a bit of a walk from the pier (check out duodopalacehotel for directions - there's a map) The room was a decent size, but filled with unnecessary furniture. We would rather have had one more suitcase stand than the armchair! The bathroom was of good size, the shower cubicle was tiny. There was a safe, and the beds were ok. The location was really the best part of this hotel. Walking distance to many sights and also lot of reasonable restaurants nearby. Our room didn't include breakfast (on arrival we were told 50euro pp!!) We had breakfast at a little cafe on Frezzeria every morning. They serve the best cappucino and sandwiches (worked out to 11euro for 2 of us!)...look out for the naughty calendars on the wall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jaycam
Reviews.Content: We were married in Ravello Italy and spent 7 nights in Positano and 5 nights in Florence and then 4 nights in Venice for our honeymoon. We stayed at the Duodo Palace. It was easy to get to by water taxi. The room was small but very clean. The shower a bit small. The location was perfect once we understood our way around it was easy to navigate. At night I would hang out my window and listen to the music of the gondolas going by, It was very romantic. The staff left a little to be desiredâ€¦ They did give us help when prompt but made us feel like we were more of a bother. They always said hello/bonn giorno or goodbye/arrivederci. But it was somewhat robotic. They werenâ€™t very warm but then most of the people in Venice came across that way. The personality of the people in Southern Italy is much different than those of Northern Italy. Iâ€™m not sure if we were just spoiled by the warm friendly people on the Amalfi coast and expected more in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: da_ken_min
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 308 in October 2007. Very good location but the mdf furnishings left a little to be desired. I took a spare pillow down from the top of the wardrobe at about midnight, and was aware of being bitten through the night. I remember thinking it was strange that I couldn't hear any mosquitos. By five I turned on the lights as I couldn't take it any more. I was covered in bites, from my head down. My eyes were half closed due to swelling. We still couldn't see or hear any mosquitos, and further inspection revealed several bed bugs on the pillow and the sheets. I presume they came from the pillow. We had to leave the hotel, which was pre-booked and paid for. The most disappointing thing about the experience was that the hotel refused to apologise and even refused to refund the unspent nights. Poor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaBruin
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds of places to stay in Venice so finding the right one could be difficult if you've never been there before. The Duodo Palace listed on various websites show being anywhere from 2-stars to 4-stars. I can tell you right now that there is no question that it is a 4-star establishment. Location is the best as it sits between one of the side canals and the street-side. It is literally 5 minutes to San Marco square. And the walk over to the square you pass by many shops, cafes, and restaurants. In fact, just 50 steps from the hotel are 3 very good restaurants with outdoor seating. If you do stay here, ask for a room with windows that open up to the canal. Gondolas go by periodically throughout the day. Have some wine, sit on the window sill, and watch them go by! My 3-yr old loved couldn't get enough of them! As far as the staff goes, they were very friendly and recommended some great restaurants bearing in mind that we had a 3-yr old and a 7-mo old. So service was great. Some other reviews said that the front desk was not very helpful. Nothing could be further from the truth. Both day staff and night staff were very amicable and helpful. Very professional and not stuffy. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to everyone else, and will be doing so. From Venice, we moved onto Florence and Rome, and the Duodo Palace was by far the best hotel we stayed at in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Made My Vacation Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Solomon88
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Duodo Palace after a pleasant train ride from Rome. As we arrived, we noticed how posh and proper the lobby was, including perfectly-attired staff. We wondered if this place would be too stuffy for us. Pleasantly, it was perfect in every way. Our room was substantial, and the bath was remarkable. The view from all three windows was postcard-perfect. The beds were comfortable, which were greatly appreciated after many long walks through the alleys of Venice. But while the building made our stay comfortable, the staff made our vacation perfect. Never in our travels has any staff made us feel so welcome, so comfortable. Francesco became a friend in a foreign place, and we entrusted our stay to him. From restaurant recommendations, which matched us perfectly, to sights to see, we felt we had our own personal guide in Venice. I have recommended this hotel to two friends already, and plan to do so for anyone else I care for who is visiting Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mj_nj
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in Florence, very clean hotel, friendly staff to happy to help you if you need it. The room was very small. You have to watch your head all the time when you are standing up. Having a shower was just impossible. You couldnâ€™t have one without sitting down. I wouldnt stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad for Duodo Palace”
Reviews.Author: sharongail
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Duodo Palace in August. We wrote ahead telling them it was our 25th anniversary and that we requested especially nice, (although we had only standard) rooms. Indeed, we were given nice rooms. Ours had a decorative Venetian ceiling and our kids was very pretty as well. We specifically said "no annex rooms". We did have an elevator, unlike the last review I read. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor...303 and 304 I think. No views at all, but nice rooms. Only problem was that we had requested no smoking and our room smelled horribly of smoke. They offered us other rooms but they were so inferior that we had them spray and stayed there. (a mistake, because the smell never left!) The location was great, it was near St. Mark's Square but very quiet. DO take the water taxi as you will NEVER find it and no one seems to know where it is. We didn't heed that advice and walked an hour to find it. Breakfast was simple but very good. Nice breakfast area. The front desk staff was not very friendly; rather, they were all pretty stiff and formal. They would answer questions but didn't bend over backwards to help at all. I am sure there are other hotels that are equally nice with friendly service as well. We did enjoy the quietness of the rooms. All in all, it was a nice place, elegant Venetian atmosphere. A few problems and lack of better service might prevent us from staying there again. If our room had not smelled of smoke, we would have probably been alot happier.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back home in Washington from Venice yesterday evening. We stayed approximatley three nights after spending four nights in Rome first during this week long trip. I must say I was dissapointed in this hotel after our luxury hotel in Rome. First of all I can not stress enough what other reviewers have said. Take a water taxi to this hotel. It was very difficult to find. People were not familiar with the location and we ended up taking over an hour to find it!! It is very confusing for a first timer. Also, we got off at the Rialto Bridge and should have gotten off at St. Mark's. Our room was on the third floor. Where our room was located is no elevator. There is an elevator to the other side rooms. As you walk in the main door the rooms to the right have access to an elevator, rooms to the left do not. We went up three flights of stairs. If you have trouble walking, climbing stairs, be aware of this. Also, I read the internet was free. It was 5Euro when we were there, so maybe a new things. I have posted a few pictyures of our room. I would say our room was nothing to write home about. Also, there were these little gnats flying around, another couple had those also. Breakafst was OK, nothing special. The location was great. The restuarant right around the corner became our favorite. Read weather before you go as it was really raining there our last night with thunder and lighting!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok”
Reviews.Author: donnakaa
Reviews.Content: I took the advice of others on this site and got a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel. If you stay at this hotel I can't recommend this enough. Yes it cost a bit ,but the the ride was better then a gondola ride and it saved such a big headach. On the return we took the ferry, but wish we had taken the taxi again. The ferry is slow and takes forever. The hotel itself is fine, nothing really special about it. If I had to do it again, I would stay even closer to Saint Marcs. We got lost plenty of times and this was our second time in Venice (first time was with a tour group). We stayed in a juinor suite, but it was much smaller then I thought it would be, even for Venice, so don't waste your money and we had no canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: VAViajero
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Duodo Palace two years ago and on our return found that it was as good as ever. Very conveniently located with a friendly and helpful staff. They got us tickets to an event called â€œMusic in the Palaceâ€�, an abbreviated form of an opera (in this case â€œLa Traviata) held in an elegant private palace. The performers were superb as was the four piece orchestra. The opera is in three acts â€“ each one performed in a different room. There were only the principals (no chorus) and the audience is scattered around the room, with the cast moving among the audience, making us feel a part of the performance â€“ a very intimate experience and highly recommended, even if you are not an opera buff. We requested and got our former room â€“ very spacious and elegantly decorated, with a view of the small canal in front where we arrived at the front door in our water taxi. The hotel has no restaurant but there are several very good ones within easy walking distance. Breakfast is quite good â€“ the usual Continental affair with ham, salami and cheese to provide some protein. Eggs and other items are available on request (but a bit pricey). We highly recommend the hotel and would certainly return if/when we return to Venice. (Word of caution: July is not a good time to be there â€“ very hot and humid and packed with swarms of visitors.) BTW, TripAdvisor lists the hotel as having two stars, but the hotel claims four stars. Somewhat confusing. I would give it three and a half stars.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful slice of venice”
Reviews.Author: equipmentmanager
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, the Duodo Palace makes you feel like a Doge. After an interminable plane trip, arriving at the door of the hotel via water taxi was like a dream come true. Our rooms were spacious for my husband and I and our three teens, and looking at the original frescos on the ceiling transports you to another time. Breakfast was very adequate and very convenient. Staff was extremely helpful, especially when my daughter became ill. The location was ideal, and I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Bazza51
Reviews.Content: You won't find a better hotel for a break in Venice. Private landing stage for our water taxi, very pleasant english speaking concierge, breakfast fine, pastries, cereal,juice, croissants etc. Room lovely, all decorative and fabric wallpaper , huge bathroom. Everywhere spotless and nothing too much trouble. Fantastic location 5 mins walk to Rialto, St Marks and Accademia Free internet so could keep in touch with the kids on msm!! Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venetian hideaway”
Reviews.Author: pgwill
Reviews.Content: We booked two weeks before travelling and our choice of hotels was limited. The Duodo Palace certainly looked great on the website and we were surprised that the online rate was reasonable (for Venice!). If you are going to Venice and intend to walk around all the little streets and alleys you need a good map. You will then have no trouble finding the hotel, and in fact their website has good instructions as well. We arrived before checkin time but were welcomed extremely graciously and shown to our room which was on the 4th floor and had a view over the roofs to the Campanile and to the Salute dome. The room was large by European city standards and the bathroom clean and well supplied. The decor was very Venetian - red and gold wall hangings and a comfy large bed.As the temperature in summer is hot (30 degrees C in May) air con is very welcome. Breakfast was certainly adequate to start the day and all the staff were polite, attentive and oh so beautifully dressed. There are plenty of good restaurants around, we ate in various sestieres of the city at recommendations in the guide book which might be far afield for some folk but we liked the stroll home afterwards, and often stopped at the cafe next to the Rialto hotel overlooking the bridge and canal for a little libation on the way back. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for San Marco”
Reviews.Author: FlipperWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The Doudo Palace is a 600-year old Venetian Palazzo which has been thoroughly and tastefully restored within the last five years. It is situated in a very quiet spot with direct access from a canal, which made our arrival a dream. The water taxi from the airport was worth the extra cost. The trip along the Grand Canal under the Rialto Bridge was breathtaking, and we were in the hotel within an hour of stepping off the plane. The hotel staff are friendly and efficient, and the room was beautiful. The bathroom was superb and it was not possible to fault this hotel in any way. The inclusive breakfast has limited choice but was more than adequate for us, and the coffee was excellent. It is possible to pay extra for cooked items but we never felt that this was necessary. There is no hotel restaurant for evening meals but the surrounding streets have a wide choice of styles and prices to suit all tastes, so this is not an issue. Directions to the hotel are signposted from the network of streets so it is comparatively easy but arrival at night, on foot, with suitcases, for the first time may well be a frustrating business. The water taxis make the whole experience far more relaxing. To round off the perfect break in Venice, returning to the airport by water taxi is recommended. The location is very central for Piazza San Marco [5min] and the Rialto Bridge [5-10min] and it is a wonderful place from which to discover Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Niamhy69
Reviews.Content: A superb little hotel at a great price. Hard to find but everything is at first in Venice. Once you arrive, greeted by very friendly staff, luxurious rooms with a nice breakfast. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel on a budget in Venice. Would definitely go back again. Niamhy, London

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location, Friendly staff, Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ThevisitorLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early February just before the carnival began with my girlfriend on arrival, fiancee on departure! Was a very nice hotel, in an excellent location with very friendly staff. Breakfast was basic but absolutely fine, they will cook eggs etc for you but I did not try that. Overall I would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it to others looking for a nice mid range central hotel in Venice. I can highly recommend a small bar/restaurant called Osteria Enoteca San Marco on Frezzeria, which is on the way to San Marco square, for a drink or light meal. I cannot recommend La Teatro restaurant near the hotel, avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! I took my husband for a surprise birthday present and considering it was all planned in secrecy, it couldnt have been better! I booked through my local travel agent but was worried about arranging transport from the airport. I found the email address and emailed the concierge (Michele). He replied almost immediately and arranged for us to be collected from the airport in a top of the range Merc who delivered us to a private launch which then took us to the hotel. They couldn't have done anything better! The hotel is in a fantastic position just off St Marks Square. It doesnt look much from the outside, but we had a fantastic room with a balcony and it was great to look out over the canal. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I can only give this a 10/10 rating (or maybe a 12/10!) It was fantastic. Will definitely be staying at this hotel again. The only down side to the hotel is they dont have tea and coffee making facilities, which would have been nice, but it was just another excuse to pay Â£5 for a coffee in St Marks and watch the world go by

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: The_photographer
Reviews.Content: We have spend 3 days February 2006 in this hotel. The hotel is very easy to find from St Marko square. From Rialto is a bit complicated. The Hotel itself is a true 4 star hotel, everything is new and very stylish, the hotel manager is extremely polite. The rooms we stayed (105 & 106) were very very nice, spacious, clean and warm. The breakfast was ok but they surprised us when we left at 7 oclock in the morning they had prepared for us a bag with the breakfast we would otherwise loose (because of of early departure). What a great service. Bravo guys. I have nothing to write but excellent review on this hotel. The only thing that bothered me was a strange smell in the room, not from the canals. More like hospital smell, probably from something they use for cleaning or some plastic. Opening the window for a while did solve this. Anyway, one of the greatest hotels i have used in my trips. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robbie&kylie
Reviews.Content: Great location near San Marco Square; good restaurants nearby, can recommend the Rosa Rosa Pizzeria ! Hotel breakfast was average, supplements required for anything cooked; reception staff very helpful; we had an inner courtyard room, if you can afford it worth the upgrade for some natural light and canal view. Thought Venice was a fab place, very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the breakfast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: checkouttheworld
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this htl w/ a friend last year for 4 days. The location is great and the room was superb! Very big, very clean and overlooking 1 canal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although, the restaurants they've recommended us were extremely expensive (even for Venice standards - you can easily find nice and cheaper places if you "shop around"-). However, the only downfall was the breakfast! Terrible in quality and variety. The bread and mini croissants were hard and stale, only butter and jam (orange only) were available and the drinks were coffee/milk or a terrible orange juice. Can't actually remember if they had any cereals available but they had no cheese, meats, yogurts, fruit, cakes/biscuits or any of the other items you would expect from a buffet breakfast in a 4 * SF category hotel. The htl has "A La Carte Menu" for breakfast, with several options to choose from, but 1 fried/scrambled egg will cost you EUR 5.00/GBP 3.30!!! In resume, everything is great but you are much better off going out for a nice breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, Venetian style in central location”
Reviews.Author: tonyj01
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is decorated in a Venetian style, as can be seen on the hotel's website. The location, near La Fenice, whilst not in a famous spot, is very central, being less than 10 minutes walk, and equidistant to San Marco, Accademia Bridge and Rialto. Another very pleasing aspect ot the location is being able to arrive by water taxi directly into the hotel lobby, just step off the boat. Gondoliers ply their route by the hotel, you hear their shouts of "Ayeee" from open windows, and their hooped shirts glide past the small breakfast room. Don't expect much of the breakfast, think of the hotel as a small city centre hotel, as in London or Paris and you will get the style. At the time of out stay there was complimentary internet access on a PC in the lobby area, occasionally a small queue. Our family's three rooms on the 5th floor were high in the eaves - plenty of space and featured a view of the campanile of San Marco from our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice several times, and although the city is amazing, the hotels can be overpriced and disappointing. Not so the Duodo Palace, however. I was travelling alone on my most recent visit (November 17-19), and found this to be a perfect place to stay. The reservations staff were prompt and efficient in confirming my reservation prior to my arrival, and the front of house team were welcoming and helpful. The hotel has a little bar where you can have a drink in the evening in safe and comfortable surroundings - useful when travelling alone. And, for the very reasonable price paid, my room was more than acceptable, with a full bathroom rather than just a shower. There are more luxurious rooms to choose from, some with canal views and balconies, and I intend to try one of these on my next visit. The hotel can be a little difficult to find, especially if arriving at night, but you can take a water taxi from the airport right to the door of the hotel. This place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: pecg
Reviews.Content: A lovely small hotel in Venice. Beautiful lobby and accessible to water taxis. Staff at the front desk and bar were helpful. Difficult to find from the train station. Would advise travelers to get directions before leaving for Venice. Take a water taxis and not the water shuttle. Would return to this hotel and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Duodo”
Reviews.Author: timbo1terror
Reviews.Content: Ah venice, what a place! The Duodo was in a quiet spot within a 10 minute stroll to San Marco and other attractions such as shops etc. Some words of advice though... If you arrive late in the evening I would diffinately take the option of a private water taxi rather than the vaporetto (water bus) option. We took the bus as it was 20euro compared to 60 but it took ages and dropped us off at San Marco from where we had to navigate over bridges and through dark streets until we finally found the Duodo tucked away in it's own niche. Not the best or least stressed introduction to one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Once the stress was out of the way the hotel and its staff were very nice. Our room was small yet immaculate with excellent aircon, a large bathroom and cable TV. The breakfast was tasty enough but consisted of the usual italian breakfast fare. Coffee and croissants etc. We found that the hotel in the piazza just around the corner and next to the opera house was really good and not too expensive. We took a private taxi on our way out of venice. On reflection the only negative was the lack of direction offered in terms of geting there and the fact that the room was rather small.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: LILynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful - our room was beauttiful and romantic (too bad I was with my mom!!!) The location was great. We had a small balcony that overlooked the canal. You could stand on the balcony and watch and listen to the gondoliers pass by. I loved Venice and I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Duodo Palace, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Anne69
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Superb position. Room beautiful. Could not have wished for a better place to spend 3 days in Venice. Room 306 is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: WoodlarkWanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of an 'extended honeymoon' as we got married just before Christmas 05. We found Venice to be everything and more that you could want as part of your honeymoon. The hotel itself lived up to the pictures on the website, the rooms were decorated to a high standard, were very clean and well stocked with many of the little extra's you tend only to get in hotels of higher ratings. Although the hotel was very quiet during our stay we did not get a room with a decorated ceiling or canal view, in fact we were next to the lift! We did find some of the staff to be a little unfriendly; we were horrified to hear the breakfast waiter telling a couple off for sitting at a table for four when there were only two of them! Although there was a breakfast menu on the table the waiter didnâ€™t make any effort or indicate that you could actually have anything from it, we were left with the breakfast buffet which I felt was a little sparse. The bar had strange unexplained hours and when we tried to get two coffee's one afternoon we were charged 20 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Billy's_girl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice on the Orient Express and when we arrived were taken in a motorboat to the Duodo Palace, it looks exactly as it does on the website. We were greeted by a courteous, helpful receptionist, our baggage taken to our room (which was the pink one on the home page) The room was sumptuous and the painted ceiling was beautiful and, as others have said the bathroom huge! We found our way around fairly easily after the first night and found the central location a huge bonus. The breakfasts were always good and the service prompt and polite. There are several nearby restaurants that we enjoyed. We both totally recommend this hotel and Venice to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Ripe for Romance!”
Reviews.Author: Ipgard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and were very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. Room overlooked the canal where singing gondoliers passed by frequently during the daytime. What a delight! Hotel staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Breakfast was in a very pleasant room next to the canal with a sufficient range of the usual fare in enough quantity to set you up for the day. The hotel was very clean and our room was tidied, cleaned and restocked by the time we got back after lunch. The hotel is a five minute walk fron St Mark's square and the Rialto Bridge, but manages to be extremely quiet of an evening. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, great staff & pretty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: b4wego
Reviews.Content: The staff was very agreeable and accomdating, room was small, but the bathroom was large and modern, the view was a courtyard. The pictures of the bedroom (on the web site) was a bit misleading, ours was very plain. The breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff was informative. The resturant in Fenice Square (Antic Martini) was excellent. The location is near everything and yet off the beaten path. We had three wonderful days in Venice and will return again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy which started our with a 3 night stay at the Duodo Palace Hotel. It was wonderful. The room was beautiful with a great view. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. I will definately choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Obviously the hotel had overbooked and when we arrived we were placed in what can only be described as a cell. The room didnt appear to be part of the hotel and was about 100 yards away. We entered the room direct from an alley way. We were kept awake all night with the noise of people walking down the alley and dragging cases along the cobbles. On the second night we had the pleasure of what appeared to be a business above our room dragging furniture around. Despite various complaints to the staff we didnt get anywhere. This was supposed to be a special weekend for my 35th birthday arranged by my wife who was extremely upset that she had booked a 4 star hotel especially for the occasion and had researched the hotel following the excellent reviews on websites such as trip advisor. How wrong could you be. As the hotel was mainly full of older couples we can only assume that they had decided to keep the younger guests outside. Needless to say we do not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but praise for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SteveDLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: Listen up Americans. I've have stayed in many hotels and B&B's throughout the world and the Duodo Palace in Venice was great. Perfect location away from the crowds but centrally located. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Free intenet access and good breakfast. Stayed in junior suite with lots of space and modern conveniences. Staff was very friendly and all spoke english. Would stay there again and this was my second trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: denholsa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Duodo Palace and couldn't fault a thing. Our room 103 didn't overlook the canal but we didn't expect it to for the price (about Â£80 a night) when you consider you can easily spend that on a meal and wine at a reasonable restaurant in venice you realise what a good deal that is. The bedrooms were spotless and typically venetian with gold fabric walls and furnishings- the bathroom large and spotless. The location of the hotel is great 10min walk to Rialto,St Marks or accademia but still very quiet. The break fast is continentla in style, venetians don't eat breakast- you can buy eggs and bacon but they are a bit pricey, the breakfast included is fine so I wouldn't bother-I particularly liked the panettone- currant bread spread with butter. The hotel staff were really helpful and not snooty (which they can be in some places in venice- the unmissable cafe Florian in Piazza St Marco, for instance).
